LTA5XeHUwThKq2bMrbp74Q.text: This place is awesome! Great sushi, great service. Been a loyal customer since day 1.  Thanks Eric & Steve..

jnPDstrbc_GLMQXO9Fz90w.text: I live up in north Phoenix but was in the area so I decided to give this place a try.  Besides the greeting I got from the host that seated me, a server didn't come to my table for about 15 minutes- which was odd considering that she was serving both booths that was on either side of mine. A lady came by who I'm assuming was either the manager or the owner and asked if I had been helped yet. I told her I hadn't so she took my drink order. The server then immediately came by and said she didn't come by sooner because she thought I was waiting for someone. Rather than making that assumption, I feel like I should have been asked or at least been given water. My food order was ready to go also so she read it back to me, then informed me they were completely out of avocado. Not her fault at all but how the heck does a sushi establishment not have avocado on a Saturday evening at 5:30 pm... when they had opened their doors 30 minutes prior. Other than that, the sushi was ok.

cNTwyWvTrjZqudEAXU_WMA.text: $2 sake during happy hour + me = pure bliss. We had a really good time here. had Drinks and apps and everything was very good. Spring rolls are bomb! okay due to the fact that sake was only $2  a round lead me to learn the hard way that it is possible to drink to much sake...let's just say the next morning was one of those where recollections of the night before trickle in slowly throughout the day..but all in all i was very pleased with my experience. Did not do dinner but dinner looks very appealing and we will def be back to try. Cool, mellow atmosphere. Pretty big place and good size crowd as well. Service was good as well, they do ask you before they seat you if you will be drinking and they give you a wristband to wear. def recommend trying this place during happy hour!

HoCWUFHbhVBoK060QXh8Kg.text: The wife and I stumbled on this ASU college sushi spot when we were early for an appointment.  So glad that we took a chance. The food was perfect, salmon was super awesome. We had 5 different salmon rolls and all were executed well. Our server, Owen, was outstanding, very attentive with just the right amount of check-ins. Overall a 5-star experience. We'll be back!

BxN1CBh2Ja7OhQ2b1cQ67Q.text: Sake bombers has always been good sushi and it's not a chain so that automatically makes me like them even more They always have food and drink specials that change every day or other day If you plan on drinking make sure you have your ID cuz they checking everybody

0ePqNDyH7vqdvyvsvnaplg.text: I really like the dark lit atmosphere. The sushi rolls and drinks were great and affordable.

BUdsP9ZKIPmhw2i9ANM_WQ.text: Love the edimames and Las Vegas Roll here. The raw salmon is good too! Tasty and affordable sushi - What else can you ask for?

fCN_40L3V2eF_j2kHqEzDg.text: DELICIOUS!!! 5 Had lunch their today for the first time. VALENTINE's DAY Sushi was absolutely wonderful. I can't say enough about Sakebomer:) they have a awesome lunch menu to choice from, which isn't expensive. Great service. Clean! Yummmmmmm

KGzahoceOCFedjlJgplVEQ.text: Came here with a friend a while back. Probably wouldn't have come here on my own. More rolls on the menu than actual sushi. That's great if you're a full on roller. Sushi itself wasn't bad but the place seems to cater to a crowd that's more about the Sake Bombers than about the sushi - so good move with the restaurant name. If you would gladly eat convenience store California rolls then this just might be the place for you. That said, dinner was a decent price for what I got. Quantity over quality? Sometimes that's ok with me. I had the Chicken Katsu dinner and some salmon sashimi and it didn't make my wallet explode and leave me living in a cardboard box holding up a sign that says "will work for sushi." Plenty of parking. Place is on the south side of Broadway just west of McClintock. Sushi on Garth! Roll on Wayne!

u8JXcAd1EKFa6LTRsCTDdw.text: This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places! The rolls are good quality, and if you go during happy hour, pretty reasonably priced, too. However, they are not stellar, and you can definitely find better quality elsewhere.   Staring with the positives:  -Great happy hour and reverse happy hour specials. Their drinks are pretty good, and the Black Raspberry Lemon Drop is awesome.  -Unique sushi rolls with fun names. Don't expect traditional here--it's definitely Americanized with a college focus. -The atmosphere is wonderful, and the low lighting and interesting seating kind of makes it look like a club  The negatives: -Your server will be hit or miss. There's a couple there I really like, but there are many who can be neglectful.  -It can get pricey. I don't mind pricey sushi, but when they're non-traditional, I don't like paying too much. Going during happy hour really helps! -If you're waiting to be seated, they take you to a waiting area with water, menus, and appetizers. I just don't understand why they can't convert these into more seating space.  It's definitely a college hangout, and it's a great place to go for a few drinks and rolls if you're not too hungry, or heading out late. They're open until the wee hours of the morning! Also, a good tip is they have a pretty cool lunch program with punch card. Definitely check it out.  Overall, great place, and great atmosphere. They do have a lengthy process for checking IDs, but I'm indifferent since it's so close to ASU.

ij35fLwRqHgVx9cWiUkvBQ.text: 1st visit, decent sushi, close to home, fairly priced. In light of the fact that there were only 6 people in the place I felt like the wristband proving my ability to drink was uncalled for. (Im 36 and bald) but whatever.   2nd visit, sat down at 945 (weariong a wrist band) my gf had arrived much earlier and ordered me a beer. (they gave last call at 930) She also explained that they were gonna close at 10 so I needed to hurry, at 10:06 I had almost finished my food and we had paid the bill so no one was waiting for us. the server was friendly as could be.  The sushi chefs started changing their shirts and turning the lights off in the area we were sitting. There is a reason most "chefs" are hidden in the back, they all have the social graces of a masturbating monkey.   So in a nutshell, it cost me $80 to find out that the idiots behind the sushi bar run the show at this china star super buffet-turned-sushi bar.  to the owners, Spend the $80 wisely because I was one of 3 customers in the entire place and I wont be returning. My guess is you wont be the last business in a retarded long string of failed restaurants in that location, unless of course you get a whole lot better.

GbK2c_gIMZS8ceOx1_55BA.text: Decent sushi. A bit over priced for the quality. I gave it 3 stars because of the great customer service. With all the restaurants there are to choose from, I probably won't be eating here again.

96WBrK3XeF_y_Dhs64v4Dw.text: The food was great, but there was a discrepancy about our bill and the staff were rude. For a party of four we ordered $150 worth of sushi and they argued with us about a $5 roll. Very disorganized.

_Pp_uClWPmdX1Z8-JK7Fqw.text: Pretty good sushi! Had a bunch of different rolls, but the Fiesta roll stood out, as well as the special which was the Honey-something roll. Great service from Kevin.

nHu7LLKyG1Q5zIUFJCLgtQ.text: Normally I love sake bombers. I've been coming here for about a year now and have never had a bad thing to say. Tonight however, our service was a joke. It took well over 30 minutes to get two rolls and the restaurant was almost empty. And our server (Emily) rarely checked on us. And when she would, she wasn't personable at all. Right up until she dropped off our checks she didn't treat us like a a server should treat a customer. And My friends and I are all servers so it takes a lot for us to not tip 20%... I tipped her 15% and I felt like it was more than she deserved. Very disappointed in the way we were treated.

rEJ_zjekMB92sma6WqJK9Q.text: Walked in and immediately greeted with a smile! Our waitress was extremely pleasant and the environment was very welcoming. The food is just as good if not better! The best Miso soup I've had and the sushi was ON POINT! We will definitely be returning!

JtsbZXdXNDUQtXLotyCZSQ.text: We were craving sushi and heard great things about this place. It was a Monday night and quiet. When we first walked in there were only two tables of people. The restaurant was empty. We wanted to sit at the bar for a drink and sushi. The host was extremely rude to us and told us to wait...for what? We waited and she never came back. We didn't feel welcomed and left.

RI_3H5Uxbcg7CRfFrchWBA.text: Despite the college-crowd name and the unassuming exterior, Sake Bomber is one of the best places in town to get your sushi fix.   There are plenty of seats, a great beer & cocktail menu - but the main attraction is the sushi chefs. They know their stuff! Today we had Steven, and he turned us on to some of of his favorites. Every sashimi dish was a little work of art, complete with their signature jalapeno fixins. Who'dve thunk jalapeno would be such a perfect pairing for tuna and bass?  Make sure to ask for their special albacore belly. It's quickly seared, but raw and pink as a jewel inside, and the ponzu sauce is perfect.  The service is great as well. Our server Owen was attentive and helpful, and another gal (with great nail art - didn't catch her name!) never let our water get below halfway before offering us a refill.  Sake Bomber is a local treasure - if you love sushi, don't miss it!

jBPg43NWfj59wJDcWbxOmQ.text: This sushi spot is the bomb ha! This roll called a "kiss my bass" roll is awesome. Going to take the recipe back home with me and try and get these sushi chefs at home to make it. Sea bass with spicy yellowtail and a lemon on top, you'd never imagine that would work but it does. Bomb dot com.

YxDq8KgIJ_agQVLqzgN9fA.text: Came here on a work lunch and it wasn't too busy on a weekday.  The food was really good and I enjoyed and was able to taste multiple sushi dishes.  All sushi was tasty, but I wasn't the one paying so I can't comment on price, only the variety.  Variety was different and we were able to sample 8 different rolls.

YHdA6EleykwN0rbMhaQYyQ.text: My fiancee and I decided to come here for our anniversary dinner before going to see a movie. I've been here on 2 other occasions but this time it was much busier. They sat us a table after a short wait and we put in our order AS SOON AS POSSIBLE since we were on a time crunch (two special rolls and a salmon skin roll).   After over 30 minutes of waiting, while watching others who were seated after us receive their food, our server apologized for the wait and said it should only take another 5 minutes.   After another 10 minutes, the manager came to apologize and offered us a complimentary bowl of edamame.  After another 7 minutes of watching other people being served THEIR edamame, our two special rolls finally arrived. I asked where our salmon skin roll was and we were told it would be another minute.   When our server finally brought the edamame, I told him "we don't have time to eat that but if you'd like to take that [edamame] back and comp the salmon skin roll instead, that would be awesome." I then witnessed him ask permission from the manager. When our salmon skin roll never came, I asked again how long that would be and I was told that it was actually cancelled.   I thought to myself, what the hell is going on? I explained very courteously that this was unacceptable, and the best the manager could muster was a slew of excuses including "It's busy", "Your rolls were more complicated to make" (which they really weren't), and my favorite "You can see we have good reviews; this just happens sometimes. Sorry".   As a manager, your job is to make sure that the business is profitable and that all of your patrons leave with a smile. I told her that we weren't happy and all she could do was make excuses for why our experience wasn't important enough to salvage.   If she had even put in even an ounce of effort and listened to an unhappy patron, our anniversary dinner might not have been such a disaster. Instead, we were late to our movie, we paid full price for the food we ate, got a bowl of edamame that we didn't order and hadn't the time to finish, and the other roll we did order was cancelled, not comp'd but canceled.   Tisk, tisk, tisk. I'm sorry but this is about as bad as customer service gets. And the last two times I came I wasn't impressed either. But we were craving sushi and I knew this place had decent rolls.   Moral of the story, if you wish to experience of feeling unvalued as a customer, come here during their dinner rush.   Let's just say I'll be exploring alternative sushi restaurants in Tempe from now on.

Pglbz7MKnPRlnr2-Wftieg.text: Awesome staff, food, and prices. They have happy hour every day, and then REVERSE happy hour for people who like to go out later.  Definitely try their dipping sauces because I've spoken to more than a couple people about how we all go there specifically for the amazing combinations we taste.  I had to coordinate a large dinner group and they very kindly called to confirm the day of, as well as set everything up for me before I got there without me having to wait 1 hour before getting seated (like other places that don't allow reservations on Fridays).

e40HM-S_v5lMzeWRknHBmA.text: I liked it, the staff was really friendly. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because I went with two other friends and we ordered about 4 rolls but they all came out at different times and we wanted them to come out all at once. The rolls and sake are superb! Will definitely be going back.

QSTbMVTQoQAC8Ul788fhMQ.text: This place is awesome!  My wife and I stopped in on a Friday night before heading off to the Tempe Improv. At first blush, it seemed a little dark. The decor is very black and red...almost like you'd find at some after hours club..only with more windows...or any windows, for that matter. But, it wasn't anything that was going to deter us from coming in.  We were greeted by the hostess who was pleasant enough. She was certain to point out the current specials drawn on the dry-erase board located by the hostess' stand. On this night, the Baja Roll was the flavor of choice. We obviously weren't ready to make such a snap decision before being seated, but we did let the idea simmer while were shown to our table.  Once seated, we took a look over the actual menu. There are several pages offering up varying concoctions, including dinner plates, sushi rolls, and even delicious cocktails available at the full bar. We knew we were about to run into a two-drink minimum in the very near future, so we opted to forego the drinks this time.  After a few times through the menu, and after deeply considering the current special, we had made our decision. For both of us to share, we decided to get two different rolls, as well as an appetizer: The Playgirl Roll and the Baja Roll, plus an order of Mussels.   The Mussels were the first to arrive. Perfect for sharing, and very nicely seasoned. The only downside to the mussels was that we didn't have forks...we had chopsticks. I am absolutely TERRIBLE with chopsticks, so I had to do a little work. Sure, I could have asked for a fork. But what would have been the fun in that, right? Plus, it made my wife laugh, and that's always an added bonus.  After our appetizer, we found ourselves face to face with two beautiful creations. The Baja Roll came on a plate with a surprisingly spicy sauce in the middle of the plate. As the manager explained during one of her many trips to our table, the Baja Roll was kind of like a fish taco, but with a Japanese twist. She was absolutely right. Delicious! Couple that with our salmon, cream cheese and avocado Playgirl Roll, and our dinner was amazing!  I'm honored to be the 100th review for this awesome Sushi spot. It turned out to be a fantastic date night dinner. Hopefully, we'll be back sometime in the near future, if only to improve my chopstick skills. I mean, I'm REALLY bad with chopsticks...comically bad.

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Read your fine print, people. 18% gratuity for 5+, 10% added for carry out.

PC6LXgX6clVJ21KKAB94GQ.text: The mark of a well laid out restaurant is a smattering of high tops, low tops, booths, bar area and singles. I also really appreciate mood lighting. Sakebomber has this is spades.  What is also has is the young, Sake-bombin college crowd. I had to get a wrist band when I walked in, if I wanted to drink.  Is this a club or a restaurant? Eeek.  The food isn't authentic, but it IS pretty tasty. If more Americanized sushi is your game, stop on in!  Overall B- C+

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lollipop Roll!

PGz1aAufojf3fUc0Nb0SjQ.text: SakeBomber is incredibly tasty! I've been stopping by occasionally for years, and now that I live within walking distance I know I'll be around much more often.  As has already been mentioned in a lot of other reviews, they have an amazing happy hour menu (and prices), and occasionally have deals where their happy hour hours are extended a great deal.   The staff has always been helpful with recommendations, and the food comes out in a timely manner which is always appreciated when you have those sushi cravings!

awcCgNwUSDoEHL5hPlMmgA.text: I moved down to Arizona from Alaska. After growing accustomed to the great fresh fish available in Alaska, I had a difficult search finding sushi that was up to par here in Arizona. That search ended when I found Sakebomber!  Aside from the amazing sushi, the staff is astounding. The staff is always very friendly sociable. It can get very busy at times, but that is probably a testament to the tasty food! Best sushi in the area hands down!

Love Kona Grill but the line up here was so intriguing we ordered more than we could eat but will enjoy it again for breakfast!  Talked with manager for a bit, talked about our Great adventure in Phoenix and this just made the trip worth while!!!!  Going to try to get daughter to go to school here so we can visit and eat here over and over again!  Jewel Dilworth

AYBkKT7tJtvITw0ZqptGeg.text: This place has great sushi if you care little about quality and you really like cream cheese and alcohol.

It's definitely nice to have this place so close by. Never been disappointed. Enjoy!

51RbGHQ2cllmTt6N5Pe9Yg.text: I am very particular about where I go for sushi.  I can name ten places I will not go to, and have struggled to find a place to frequent; until now.  I have only been here about 5 times, but every time was a great experience.  Great food, staff, prices,and atmosphere.

2QifTWd1wLFVAmWByKaQUQ.text: Disclaimer: I like sushi. I don't love sushi. I don't crave sushi. When some one mentions that we should go get sushi, I am usually pretty neutral. When I get to a sushi place, I am excited about sushi. I always order too much sushi and can't eat it all.   I've been to Sake Bombers twice now and thought I would throw together a review. All in all, it's a bit better than average. I'd probably give it a 3.5 if I could.   It's a far cry from traditional sushi, but that's fine with me. In fact, my favorite thing we got last time was the Chimichanga Roll that had chicken in it and some killer salsa to dip it in. The more standard rolls are good as well and the girl likes it and she's got much better taste in sushi than I do.   Price wise its very reasonable for sushi and if you want a good place to knock back a few for a nice low price, the aptly named Sake Bombers definitely fits the bill.

i2tYpkvGBe1XD_H5SGGUhg.text: Okay, I know this is not the best or most authentic sushi around. That said, it's a fun neighborhood place to go on a Friday or Saturday night, have a few drinks, and enjoy guilty-pleasure sushi.   The waitstaff was friendly and prompt, although the hostess was a bit awkward. I found it kinda odd that they check IDs at the door and give you a wristband, but it sort of reminds me of a waterpark, which is exciting I guess.   The happy hour specials are definitely the biggest reason to come here, but we got a little carried away since everything was discounted. It adds up fast if you aren't careful (read: after a few cocktails, whooo!)! I live nearby, so I'll probably be back soon.

2qKmewVgiY45ie7IvE_eYg.text: We love this place!!! Awesome sushi and good servers!

nUxIe76vu98FdDCu83sz1g.text: Sooooo yummy! They have a great big menu of sushi items to choose from... the special rolls are really good. Love this place!

oLgk93lqqPVjthu0MzZA0g.text: We've never had a bad time. It's our favorite sushi place at anytime of day. The set-up inside is contemporary, but not too much. Great staff, great food & with happy hour & reverse happy hour, it's happy hour literally all day long. They now serve for lunch too. Our favorite is the Firecracker roll. We get it every time even though it's one of the more expensive one's, but be careful with its habenaro sauce(use sparingly. You can also order that sauce as a side anytime). The sauce is bomb! & all the rest is always fresh and good! The sake bombers are a decent price & my friends always have a few while I have an icy cold Kirin. Totally worth checking out, but leave a place for us on Fridays!

The rest of the food had bad flavor.   They need to get some senior sushi chiefs before you go . . these guys are not good.   I love sushi and I have eaten a lot of it . . all over the .world including Japan .. this place you would be better off going to the grocery store.

A4Etxzf5Jd0xLbJnHNXf6g.text: spank me roll was BANGIN' and they got my beer, asahi black! server was great, thanks to kaitlynd. i recommend. the only weird thing is that i had to wear an arm band to enter. i would assume for ordering alcohol. i guess they dont trust their servers to check ID.

keccaEM8gjEkHHHPqLj7hg.text: Great happy hour! All sorts of different flavored sakes, and american style flavoring (ie; peach, mango, raspberry, etc). Prices are good, and the rolls are as well.

OiTb23f-8AmaCh-0bvNBPw.text: Sucks! Didn't let us do real sake bombs, bad sushi, uneducated staff. Two thumbs down

0ceYUntY26n-8zsV2222qA.text: Best sushi joint ever! I've had sushi all over the world but this is still my favorite place. They offer great drinks, delicious fresh sushi and a fun atmosphere. The staff offer some of the best service and are always friendly/welcoming. The prices are really good and they offer reverse happy hour even on Friday night. I recommend this place to anyone looking for good sushi and have gotten quite a few friends hooked on Sakebomber.

p3yveDuk5o4dlyUwHShUCw.text: Sake Bombers are $7 during happy hour and this place has food. The interior is pretty great too. This place definitely beats Saketini.

0XbiXd0GmZ_mPPxsXDlcNw.text: The only reason I'm not giving it 1 star is because I've been here before and experienced better! I understand that they "allegedly" were caught serving alcohol to a minor but seriously waiting up front and having to receive a wrist band to get one of the awful drinks was a waste of my time!! So yes the drink was awful! It tasted so fake and nasty! Bad cheap vodka. The salmon nigiri was bad bad bad bad bad!! OMG! BAD!! The playboy roll was not good either! It was an all around bad experience!! I may never be back here when their are several sushi places in the area that have yet to let me down.

veXOMGhK0-JRwDi14CbmgQ.text: Fuck it - I'm giving this place 5 stars.   It's far too easy to be a sushi snob I guess - which is funny since we're in Arizona - but I meet them all the time. It's also kinda funny to me how sushi-lovers love to hate sushi restaurants. It's like you ask a sushi fanatic where to go and they snidely scoff and mumble something about an exotic little place off the coast of wherever that they've probably only been to once if at all and suggest you might as well pick up a steamy dog shit off the lawn and eat that if you're going to eat at whatever place you were asking about.   I think it's meant to make the rest of us feel stupid for not being an expert. Well I'm a novice - I've only been to about a dozen different sushi places probably less than 50 times. I like the stuff, but I'm not from Japan or anything... I don't have it in my blood. I just know what I like and I tend to get the same or similar things wherever I go.   So given my experiences with sushi places and restaurants in general, I have to say this place is great. The servers were friendly and attentive, the decor was nice and kinda swanky without being overdone, the music sucked but wasn't too loud, and the food was quite good. If that doesn't make a 5 star joint, I don't know what does.  We had a roll and a teriyaki chicken dish from the menu along with a small bottle of sake that we bombed. Everything was crazy good. Oh, and we had edemame as well. The roll was pretty huge compared to most places and the chicken dish was ridiculously huge. For all the food we had, the prices were pretty reasonable.   To be honest, I expected this place to suck. The location, the outside, the name, etc... it all kinda gave the impression this wasn't going to be any good. Well, it was... so I guess... don't judge a book by its cover?   This isn't a chain, it doesn't smell fishy inside (at least it didn't when I was there), and it's clean. Compared to places like zen32 or stingray, this place holds its own. I think it kicks Ra in the ass - and I kinda like Ra okay. I ventured into the bathroom and it was clean and nice, but a little hodge-podgey (2 different styles of sink)... nice though... and clean.   I was actually a little shocked to see so many negative reviews after enjoying it so much... I guess that's the beauty of this site - it's all opinions, so nobody gets to be "right" and nobody has to be "wrong." If you're like me and you enjoy your Americanized sushi restaurant grills, you may really enjoy this. If you're a sushi genius, your mileage may vary.

18V7KHvbnMm8drkmaun1Gw.text: Ah yes, American sushi.    White, frat boy sushi chefs.   The server was under 21 so her friend had to drop off the drinks as she followed here to the table.  It's an alright place, not bad for ASU but that's where the buck stops. The asparagus app. was good. The rolls were good.  We didn't get sick, good.  Smoking hot Asian hostess..... arrrrrrrr...............

X-mqTuLMCRcSw5eHXyAmnQ.text: I got a call from a friend the other night that a new sushi bar had opened across from her  local laundromat. Not knowing exactly what to expect from a sushi bar called "SakeBomber" I diligently made my way down to Tempe to check this place out, hoping to find another great sushi happy hour (which runs Monday through Friday 5-7 p.m. as I write this review).  I definitely got the nightclub vibe from SakeBomber. It was low lit with colored lights lighting the bar, there were flat screen TV showing sports and hip-hop music playing just slightly too loud (perhaps they're taking a page from the Ra play book).  There was no wait for a table during the Wednesday night happy hour. I ordered edamame, a crispy california roll and a spicy salmon roll. My friend got a spicy tuna roll and a crispy eel roll. While we didn't do any SakeBombs (hey, you wanted a legible coherent review right?) we did enjoy some $1 warm sake.  I'd love to write you something more descriptive here... but all I can really come up with is that "the sushi was pretty good." I enjoyed it, but it didn't knock me off my feet (although the spicy salmon was actually spicy, a nice change from most other places I've tried in the valley). The rolls were slightly larger than what gets served at Sushi 101 (what I would classify as SakeBomber's most direct competition). The only problem I have with this is that it gets difficult to get the entire roll in your mouth in one try.  After reading everything above, you might be thinking to yourself, "Why the heck did he give this place four stars?" Price. Although this wasn't the best sushi in the world and I personally didn't care for the atmosphere, as I write this, the happy hour menu is probably the most reasonably priced I've found. Edamame and two rolls during happy hour  was only $11.  I'm definitely going back to SakeBomber... not only do I want to try some things on the non-happy hour menu that looked enticing, continuing to go at happy hour will hopefully keep the sushi monkey on my back from continuing to eat a hole in my pocket.

rAGfxL2ttRsqEDuVZZYQ4Q.text: Sushi in Phoenix is a touchy subject. But, some friends had heard good things about Sake Bombers so we decided to drink away the week there. We were seated immediately and our server, who had a great butt, came over and asked for our drinks. We ordered some baked tofu and also edamame. Baked tofu was awesome and the miso soup was good too. As for the sushi, a friend ordered the Vegas roll and she said the jalepenos on it were kinda unnecessary. I had an avocado roll and the veggie roll sans cream cheese which were both good.  Sake Bombers gets a -1 star for letting us continue to drink sake...two bottles of sake between three girls. And gets another -1 on the fact that our server, mr. cute butt, did not ask for our phone numbers. Scratch that...it wins one star back for the excellent service and very friendly staff.

LFhjKfhJmphImWV-HBdudw.text: Alright, so here's the thing:  I like to drink.  It's something I do well, and I figure that anything you can do well should be done often.  With that being said, I do not take it lightly when a restaurant names itself after an alcoholic beverage (we'll get to Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville later).  That being said, it was my brother of all people who introduced me to Sake Bombers.  He said to me "Las Vegas rolls, chicken wings and a sake bomber will do you just right."  He wasn't lying.  The problem that people may have with me reviewing a sushi bar is that I don't eat seafood.  I'm allergic to a lot of it.  So you may be thinking "Why in the shit am I reading this, you twit?"  Well, because I'm not allergic to alcohol or appetizers, two things that Sake Bombers does well.    The chicken wings they serve have an Asian influence and a spice to them, though I wouldn't call them spicy.  They're a dry rub, not sauced, and they're swear-to-god delicious.  Now, I don't eat sushi, but I'm told by all that accompanied us that the Las Vegas roll, with jalapeno in it, and the White Castle roll, with cream cheese and horseradish, are delicious alternatives to the more standard fare.  As far as the alcohol goes, during happy hour you can get warm sake for $1, a full bomber set for $5, and a Kirin or other Japanese beer for $4.  They have a variety of other cocktails and such, so every type of drinker will be pleased.  The mood is right, tv's and music playing, the crowd is mixed between college-types and after-work specials, and the service is good.  If you don't go to Sake Bombers, I'll fight you.

UF065qd5vHum4-dx_tLBFw.text: Sake Bomber is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant for a number of reasons.  1. The service is great! Everything ordered is brought out ASAP and the staff is very friendly and helpful. After only a couple visits, the manager and staff recognized us and knew our preferences.  2. The prices are reasonable. This isn't some basement bargain sushi but it's not going to empty your wallet either. For those that are on a bit of a budget, they have great happy hour and reverse happy hour deals as well as daily food and drink specials.  3. The food selection is great and so is the taste. This is one of the only sushi places I can bring my non-sushi-eating friends and we are all happy with what we ordered.  In addition, the atmosphere here is great. It's not blaring music like it's a dance club, but it's certainly not dull. The decor is great and they often have sports on half their TVs and other programming on the rest (I believe they had G4 on the last time I was there).  After looking over my review, it's clear I'm not a good writer. Oh well. The point I'm trying to make is that this is a great place and I highly recommend it to everyone.

YUvS1j9d9APczGaGukOgOQ.text: A great place for drinks and sushi for a great price. IT Is very nice in here and the "Tokyo iced teas "are fantastic. It's happy hour all day long. Amazing sushi!!

5OaYM0jA24SO1r42zK-c1g.text: The sushi was pretty good.  The service was friendly.  Most of the rolls are either fried or had something fried inside.  I don't mind having stuff fried but when I go to sushi I don't want to have to search for food that isn't fried.  I would suggest this for people who don't really like raw sushi or people who are new to sushi.

QEItL_0qZf-E11WK_g7uZQ.text: Love it!! My bf and I just happened to run into this place and we both enjoy the food especially the Vargas roll. We go every time we are craving sushi.

J3TGWcsDI_rzpB-9y5AWgw.text: Great place, I love it when the sushi chefs have kung-fu movies on.

BfSpmSmPxMCvIMtIRLEK_g.text: A good little Sushi joint not far from our house. Good specials and overall pricing. Every bit as good as an expensive Scottsdale Sushi Bar, without the additional strain on the wallet.   Las Vegas roll, soft shell crab appetizer and the baked mussels are always good choices.

CsHxHbgJYPDbv7C0o2xk9w.text: Eh...it was cheap but the tuna that came with my salad wasn't that high quality.  They don't salt the edamame, but they are bigger than most sushi bars. I don't think I would come back here, even for the drinks.  Not the most inspiring Yelp review, but the restaurant wasn't either.

bTHyCfQlsaGuZkkAjOmbqw.text: I come to Phoenix once a month for business.  Every time I am in town I MUST stop by and get my sushi fix... Ok, the sake bombers aren't bad either.  The sushi chefs are personable, the food is FAB, the atmosphere is good.  I have never been disappointed when coming here and their prices are very reasonable as well.

sLzrw3va-WEDUSai7rISvw.text: I love saki bomber. They don't have happy hour it's more like happy DAY!  Great prices great sushi and the infused saki they have is cheap (6 bucks) generous and delicious. The lychee is my favorite.

WMsABclwGQd1NO2krBHECQ.text: I was not expecting great sushi from a location that was formerly a Village Inn.   Fortunately the VI is long gone and the sushi was very good.      Its better than most of the other sushi places around and not too hard on the wallet.

12i6kmTPiRAek9AB9ciy2w.text: Simply the best. Steve is an artist with seafood. Always treated like family, always leave full and happy. Without a doubt, you will not find more flavorful, more creative sushi at a better price anywhere in town.

7HeV3UZTT5mCVLsPOgBWFA.text: It's great food, but the prices for the traditional plates were higher than I was expecting.

PvSsQ8P_U74YGC53UbY1Kg.text: To be honest with you I really don't have any reason to not give it the full 5 stars. I guess I am saving that negative star for sometime in the future, nobodys perfect.   1. The atmosphere : I really enjoyed the lighting, It wasn't bright like some places I have been to, and it wasn't dark like others (ra). I really liked the art behind the bar and the over all feel of the place. It also had kind of a sweet smell? My only complaint was the music that was being played, It was some R & B hip hop type crap. Maybe it wouldn't have been so obnoxious if they had turned it down a little.  2, The Service: Awesome! Our server stopped by our table to refill our drinks the second it looked like we finishing them up. She was also kind enough to point out this guy that was carrying a giant knife on his hip, or as she said "do you see the guy with the machete on his side" .  3. The SUSHI : All we had were rolls this time. I saw a couple of rolls that I had never seen before "Boston California roll" and a couple of others, but that one.. Holey SHIT! Amazing! I really like their take on the Las Vegas Roll. SUSHI ROLLS = A+  Thats all I got. Now I am going to go talk shit on Zen 32 and TV and Sushi.

KTCuU6i2Co9IOTconXyQOw.text: I come here often and the service is okay. However the last couple of times I've had someone I've never seen there before and she is awesome! Best service I've had coming here! I don't remember her name I just remember her name being written on her name tag all creatively but she was very nice and checked on us frequently. Oh and the food it great! :)   *Food is great but I'm writing this to complement the server. That's how you get people to come back is by having good employees.

RJR4DHmGJ3vi5ftYQI2Eww.text: This is my Absolute favorite restaurant in Tempe! No Place I've yet to visit comes close to their salmon nigiri! Great prices and high quality atmosphere and environment along with high quality staff and management. You've Got to come give this place a Shot! Best in Town!

FUQhL7-F1E-bumbkRgkJRQ.text: I got their combo lunch special and the proportion of the food is very big. However, the food all taste the same. Their Philly roll has less than 5% of cream cheese. I almost thought there's none. The service was alright, but if you're coming here with a date, I guess it could be romantic since the atmosphere is pretty chill.

arSmFDtX9uJv4ZraMacXjg.text: Honestly the worst sushi place I've had. Rolls are so small for what you pay and not full of flavor like other rolls I've had elsewhere. Walked into the bathroom and one of the employees was in there she walked out without washing her hands. Yuck.

UOC0hrh_kd2gzvIwgQKdmQ.text: There is nothing like eating raw fish into the night. Everything that was brought out was perfect tenderness and has the perfect bite to every style.   As for the sake bombs, they were on point.  I could not ask for a more enjoyable experience when eating sushi. Check it out sometime

w4lUkssZ_fNtlsC1SiV95Q.text: Omg!!  I don't know how to express my excitement that I found this good place. They have the most tasty rolls and most fresh fish I've ever had since I moved to Arizona. I can't understand those ppl who gave them less 3 stars. It's ridiculous. Or....they just don't know what REAL good food is.(Haha, it's just my opinion.)  anyway, I will definitely  go back , and recommend to anybody who loves good food like me.  Sakebomber, you guys are AWESOME!!

ArKS-As4KinZhAjdCqB9cw.text: I can't believe this place is still in business, the list of things wrong with it is quite extensive. Filthy. As soon as you walk in you're greeted with the smell of foul old fish. Poor service staff. Sub par quality of fish. Badly constructed rolls and dishes. Terrible sake selection, yet they have the confidence to use the word 'sake' in their name.   This place is so bad you might as well get your sushi from a convenience store.  Apparently they also think they're a club and want you to wear a bracelet to identify yourself as over 21 while you sit at a table for dinner.  Absolute garbage.

TESlBSLJMFbTzBdaWIXLPg.text: Pro: cherry blossom roll Con: salmon dynamite roll  I ordered whitetail sashimi (good) cherry blossom roll (also good) and their reverse happy hour miso for a dollar, which wasn't bad.  But the con of my meal was the salmon dynamite roll, it came out on a plate and it just wasn't what I was expecting. Instead of standing the roll up in a line, it was laid flat on a plate with a handful of this under seasoned salmon mixture and broiled with panko. It was just not my thing. Wasn't horrible enough to not finish but blah, not worth ordering again.  They do check IDs at the front if you're planning on drinking, if not they waive you through.  Overall I'd come here again, the prices weren't all bad. Service was pretty quick.

v3BDtFAn56wh_6J__MZDUA.text: We went here on a weekday around 5:30 pm. Fast service and nice employees. I got their special roll which was very good and came with miso soup and a side salad. Reasonable sushi prices. Probably not the best sushi I've ever had but very decent!

RnZv5fRIL5yyML0Hu9DHOA.text: Always good food and fantastic sake. I had the Elder flower infused sake with their special Sensei roll! Amazing! Steven and Zach behind the Sushi bar are on point. Steven set us up with some of his favorite sauces and I appreciate that because we enjoy spicy food.  Thank you for the service!

8QdT2liMFDafBFPL_yu96g.text: Didn't expect to like this place but I was so so wrong! Sushi is great and fresh, flavors are awesome and atmosphere is nice! Servers can be a little short but definitely understandable. Prices are super affordable if so glad I found this place :)

RnsaeK-Rhq7Ay9PDQRl_Eg.text: The sushi is good with plenty of variety to choose from and they change up the specials often. Three stars as this used to be our go to sushi place but after our Valentine's Day experience, am doubting we will return. Called in reservation and what was supposed to be a 20 minute wait turned in to 40 at the door. The hostess claimed to have called my husband's name but butchered it so badly, no one understood her and she marked us off the list. Got seated after inquiring and given a bowl of free edamame for our wait. Ordered 4 rolls and waited another 45 minutes with no food. Looked around and others who came in after, with no reservation, were getting food. Finally got the attention of the sever who shared they were behind but quickly returned with one roll and then a second. After waiting two hours all together, we canceled the last two rolls and asked for the check and a box. The manager did apologize but their customer service is terrible and free edamame was not worth the trouble.

5OY2MVWwHCtq00-E5vP9eg.text: Finally got to stop in after hearing so much about this place.  We loved it. The sushi was really good, though it seemed as if a lot of their special rolls had a kick to them.  Our server was super accommodating, and well versed with everything.   The place lacked some authenticity. I have never been in a sushi bar that player reggae. Not that I mind it... I just found it interesting.   Definitely worth a try.

fZ6ya_VyYY6y30717_2CWg.text: The waitress was very nice and the atmosphere was fun and light.   I had the lunch sashimi special and a boba thai tea. I would not get the sashimi here again, it just was not great and it took too long to come out. Also the miso soup was probably the worst I have had. The thai iced tea was good.   Might try 1 more time but not the sashimi.

3AXLKYvE06p16JbsDLmQTA.text: Went in for a date and we both thought it was great. There weren't too many people in as it was the middle of the week, so we got our appetizers and drinks right away. We got the veggie tempura, chicken Katsu dinner, and some sushi of course. It was all really good . Way better than ra which is where we went before. The only thing is we got the fried ice cream to split when it's more for one person. Everything came out quick and I liked the way the inside was decorated.

iTwJVmK6Cc97JEvmGwJlNw.text: Wait staff was attentive. Food came out fast. But the quality of food was sub-par Might as well go to Frys to buy sushi.

1xE0twPiK_ffDQVOBs-lpA.text: Had a birthday gather last night at this place with my boyfriend and friends. Sushi was alright, but the happy hour was pretty good. They have a happy hour menu and a reverse happy hour menu. Ask them about it.   For food:  My boyfriend and i got sea bass, and tuna. One order has 2 pieces for $3.5. We got one of the special rolls, playgirl and volcano rolls. Playgirl was alright. I wasn't a fan of fried sushi, so volcano was eh. overall, the sushi rice was mushie, :/ At the end, we ended up getting yakisoba, and that was eh as well. For the food, i'll give it 2/5 because I had better.  Dranks:  My boyfriend got Sake bombs with your choice of beer for $7? and if you were to get a beer for itself its already $5...mind as well add an extra $2 dollar and get some sake going. What I really like were the Flavored/infusion Sakes. Lychee sake was pretty good. I believe it was $6.5. I think it'll be more worth it if I taste the sake a bit. It felt like it was all lychee syrup :/. For the dranks, i'll give it 3/5.  I think this place good for group events and such but only for happy hour. As for dinner? elsewhere.

zMyEVlZpr5oJQonufS-iCQ.text: This is a cool sushi spot but the people that work here have bad costumer service. Good sushi though.

ZnmSxORKKeZd7deEsKc4tQ.text: Great food and great service. We had the Evil roll which was great as well as the Kiss my Bass roll. Both were excellent.

07qT23CAuvDilb5QE9r8tQ.text: Nothing special about this place, food and service were okay..saki flight was overly sweetened. Probably won't venture back any time soon

zy9LxRyH8G-CoJo6Nyk_vQ.text: I'm all about the 1) Atmosphere and the 2) Attitude. Sake Bombers does a good job in both respects. Lets start with the negatives as always: - You do have to wear a wristband in order to drink alcohol because apparently they were part of sting operation for serving under age groups. You will run into a lot of ASU kids here. - I've seen small children in here on a couple occasions, which you don't typically see at Sushi joints. I don't roll with screaming kids. - The sushi here is good, but not mind blowing. This place is the most bang you will get for your buck from a sushi perspective. I'm sure everyone has already raved about the happy hour, but in case this is the only review you read: They essentially have an all night happy hour, due to happy hour coinciding with reverse happy hour. Both of these have great deals, here are the links to those menus: sakebombersushi.com/file... sakebombersushi.com/file... If you like Wasabi, GET THE FRESH WASABI. It will make you wonder why anyone would ever eat that play-doe wasabi again. Another favorite of mine is the lyche sake. This shit is no joke people. Order it. They have an excellent variety of drinks, sushi and apps. I've always had great speedy service. The ambiance is superb. As always, I'm not good at being positive, so the fact I'm giving out any compliments should blow the doors off your Geo Metro. YA FEEL ME?!?

axrJygVvj_xctDaiKcO4FQ.text: Went to this place today with two classmates for lunch between our classes.  Overall the place looked clean, though rather empty. We seated ourselves, per the sign's instructions upon entering, and were greeted almost immediately. The waitress did not hover around while we were going over the menu and deciding what all we were wanting to get.  I wound up settling on the L6 off the lunch menu, which featured two full size rolls from a stated selection with miso soup and a bitter salad on the side. Overall, I wasn't displeased, but the place is not deserving of stellar or amazingly fantastic reviews. The spicy tuna roll was not spicy at all, and the texture was a bit off. The tootsie roll was fine, but I have had better at other sushi bars.   I would go back for the lunch special, but this would not be my go-to place for high-end sashimi.

49GywP7C3Yali6NjGpN2_g.text: This was probably the worst experience I have had eating sushi.  The process of checking ID's is ridiculous!  Three different tests to drink your cheap booze?  I understand that you probably got busted serving someone underage, but please.  The check id three times before being seated is ridiculous.    We also asked the hostess if we can sit in a booth, and she led us to a table.  I understand if there are no booths, I can survive.  Too bad there was a booth open, so we of course asked to sit there.    Our server seemed annoyed that we wanted  to put out separate checks on separate orders, that way it can be easier to split the check at the end.    Another negative, they brought out the "fried apps" even before the miso soup or edamame at the table.  How did that happen?  Eventually we get the soup, and have to ask about the edamame.  Turns out they were out and had to make a new batch. They did not even bother to tell us until we aked.  Asked for some eel sauce on the side of the app, told it is a dollar upcharge because it is labor intensive for 3 to 4 hours?  Not one other sushi restaurant has ever charged for eel sauce.    The rolls, were very much subpar.  All three of us ended up rushing home feeling the urge to use the bathroom in a very negative way.  This is the first and last time I will ever go to Saki Bomber.

FBcrGYGJkhehlUNX-i7bGw.text: Always have excellent happy hours and the sushi is delicious. Atmosphere is very intimate and welcoming.

ARDgjhLxjGjw_j37WFZ9wQ.text: The atmosphere, food & drinks here are excellent... Definitely a place to enjoy the experience of eating sushi! A great start to an awesome evening!!

FF9KSZm7AW8Afk7E4bsh0w.text: Sake Bomber is too legit to quit.  The pricing is reasonable and they serve large, delicious rolls. The location is kinda sketch and it looks like the building is possibly abandoned. But, it cranks out those bad boy rolls like you wouldn't believe.   Try the Tasty Tuna, it's awesome! It's basically a shrimp tempura roll, topped with spicy tuna, eel sauce, and tempura flakes. Mmmmm. Goodness I'm craving one now! The shrimp tempura, Boston roll, and tootsie maki also do not disappoint. I'm sure everything on their menu is decent.  I give them kudos too for always making a special, made-to-order roll for my boyfriend and I every time we come in. Try it--- it's made with rice, fried calamari, cream cheese, and topped with eel sauce and tempura flakes. :)

9KGOXxz6W_Ejh9AgXwwgow.text: Went here for lunch. It was pretty empty and we got to sit at the bar right away. The lunch special that I got included miso soup, tiny salad and a Crunchy California Roll. I also got a Thai Tea. The food tasted very good, fresh and savory. The other rolls that I saw also looked good. I would come back and try other rolls. No pictures-- I ate everything too fast.

5lBWIfzrNpHopNon9bVrSw.text: (Lyrics - Pat Benatar - Hit Me With Your Best Shot)  Hit me with a sakebomb Why don't you hit me with a sakebomb Hit me with a sakebomb Fire Away!  Well your real good fried rice with a long history Of filling little bellies, like the one in me Before I put another piece of roll in my mouth You better make sure it doesn't wipe the smile off my face!  Hit me with a sakebomb Why don't you hit me with a sakebomb Hit me with a sakebomb Fire Away!  First opinion when I first walked into Sakebomber was Wow!  I think I like that modern sushi them mixed with traditional Japanese decor.  The place was definitely hip and had a huge sushi bar.  Drink selection was pretty good too!  LCD TV screens help lit the room while the sushi chops away.  I wasn't too fond of the layout of the tables since I thought was pretty close to each other.  I have the tendency to feel someone is listening.....haha!  Moreover, I'm not too knowledgeable about sushi so I let me two counterparts do the ordering.  However, I must say the best dish of the night had to go to the fried rice.  Yes, I'm sure it had a long history Pat.  The rice itself was not made from the traditional rice like most Asian restaurants.  I believe they were actually made with sticky rice rice; if that makes since to you gwhy-los.  I think that's what did it for me, but it was also well seasoned and even though we ordered the vegetarian one - I'm sure the one with meat taste just as awesome.  My second intrique dish was the sakebomber fries.  Breaded with panko I believe and fried.  This was different and it taste like it was fresh cut potatoes.  Kudos for that cause I love fresh cut potato fries and to add that extra crunch!?  Yum!  The rolls we ordered were nothing too special and probably and second thought in my mind.  My two friends that join me that night quoted -- "It's not bad.  I like the fried rice, but nothing stand out for me" Kathy H.  While Ms. Tang quoted "Food was okay.  Good service. Fried Rice was the bomb". - sakebomb?  Maybe next time - wink!  Service was indeed good.  Our hostess was very pleasant while putting the pink wrist band around my wrist.  She explained they got busted for serving underage kids.  Hey you that's underage -- you know who you are -- if you want to drink stay at home or wait til your 21!  Quit ruining it for the rest of us!  Anyways, our server Yoshi did a phenomenal job and was quite knowledgeable about the menu.  He sold us on the fried rice and it was a winner!    Overall, the food was okay, but the server was tops.  Price wise -- going for HH is a recommendation.  We had a party of 3 and it came out to be about $20 per person.  Next time I drop by think I'll get hit with a sakebomb! - Enjoy!

hDiK-0yS4AuRkq7WqfVRkQ.text: Great service, quiet place and dim atmosphere. The best value and price combo sushi for what you can get in Arizona thus far that I have discovered.   Not super loud like other sushi places nearby typically are. Reasonable prices; got 5 rolls or so and split between myself, my boyfriend, and a friend.    Came out to only $20 per person and we were super full at the end without even loading up on appetizers or alcohol at all.   For those complaining about sushi being expensive, that's the norm for most places as the quality and special preparation are what you pay for. Also try and get bar seating so you can talk to the super awesome chefs and watch your sushi being made in front of you!

lGDarybznGH1tF26FTFy7g.text: Decent experience overall. I think they're prices are pretty good, but it seems like a cheaper end sushi place. The bench I was sitting on at a booth was all torn up and uncomfortable to sit on.   I've been here before when it was much more bumping and energetic, but I think this time was meh.

97rcFL_YtV37DOEfr64BDQ.text: I come here once a week (at least), and I always leave happy. They have a great happy hour menu- $1 miso soup and $2.50 for edamame!  The Dragon Roll is very very good, and the eel it's topped with is delicious. Sometimes sushi restaurants use cheap eel, which is fatty and gross, but here that is not the case. I also regularly enjoy the Crispy California roll, the Tootsie roll and Shrimp Tempura roll.   I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. I have experienced great service here time and time again, which is key for my return. The wait staff is always super friendly, quite hospitable and give good recommendations.  I love this place. I'm always craving it!

RHjjAuuB5mNh1Qx9I1Uv0A.text: This place is good. I had the teriyaki chicken meal. It came with rice and another side that I didn't like. We came for lunch and the restaurant is pretty dark, I guess it was a little weird because it was during the day and not very busy. The food was good, but it really didn't stand out to me. The staff was nice and accommodating.

hJ_XtVhYsHMYItkyF0OxbA.text: Really cute, and we  had great service, I just didn't feel like the sushi was good quality. Everything was drowning in the eel sauce which also had a questionable flavor.  We have sushi once a week and love trying new places. Won't be back to this particular place.

YiSse_Gz7OYGvyDpd8VqWQ.text: This place is by far the best sushi in tempe! They always take care of their customers; from the servers to the chefs to the managers... they only want to provide the best service and food for everyone! Super friendly! I understand the wristband situation... hey sorry they don't want to lose their liquor license for underage drinking (if you're mad be mad at the fake id's not the restaurant it's not their fault they want to continue to serve liquor) this place is fun, great location,  great happy hour prices, and great staff! Will def come back again !

O1h6hZm7yF7_nHhUWA1nsg.text: I met a friend here for sushi yesterday. I've passed by it a million times but that was the first time I had gone. When I walked in I felt like it smelled a little funny, but that went away once we were in the dining area. If you plan on drinking, they ID you at the front entrance and give you a wristband. Sort of odd, but I guess necessary if you're trying to keep a business open.   It was HH while we were there (5-9pm), so we ordered a couple of apps and rolls. We had the pork gyoza, crab puffs, california roll, killer shrimp, and I think the crispy california roll. Everything was ok - nothing extraordinary. The service was good, but considering the HH were pretty high, I'm not sure I'll return.

YTEAtJdTCULEPY3vx88p0g.text: This place has been our go to sushi for about 3 years. We have tried several places and none have ever come close to the quality here. Each time we come here its constantly good and we leave extremely satisfied! Don't waste you time at other places, this is the best sushi in Tempe/Maricopa. Try the Playgirl, Lollypop, White Castle or rainbow you won't be sorry!!!

83GcriPrLEFhC1u9Hhnjlw.text: I have only eaten here twice, both times during the later happy hour they have. Food is good, drinks are as well, but the service was always the best!  Their late night happy hour is perfect for our schedule.

cWyS_OgPfkGY71XjGq-1VA.text: If you drink , u need a wristband. Get it at the front counter. Or no booze 4 u! Laid back. Ok sushi nothing special. Basic Sushi in Tempe. Great for ASU students

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy hour teriyaki wings

ZhhXfxzKjZ_YnbgWTXg4Yw.text: Let's face it, we all have our favorite sushi restaurant and we hate to waiver from what we "know".  Trust me, there is green grass on the other side.  This place has an amazing staff and sushi with a flare.  Hayley my server was the best.  Thank you!

QN6h_Mo2ArlZiqp6dOKifA.text: Never going back, mostly because they shortchanged us!  We went Friday night, late, 10ish. The carding and the wristband at the front wasn't that big a deal--it didn't take up too much time, so I was okay with that. The place was maybe about half full, certainly not as crowded as I was expecting for a Friday night, but the service was still suuuper slow. The appetizer, pork gyoza, came out pretty fast, but there was a huge gap between our appetizer and sushi. We were starting to think maybe they were waiting for us to order cocktails before they finally brought out our first plate of sushi, California rolls. There was another big wait between the California rolls and the tootsie rolls.  The pork gyoza was okay but expensive, almost a dollar per gyoza. The sushi was nothing phenomenal, but what can you expect in Arizona?  The most annoying thing, though, was that we paid cash, and we were supposed to get $19 and some small change back, but our waitress gave us $14 and small change. They stole even more than what we would have tipped, considering the terrible service. Literally never going back here.

QrJnBTJZRWJGnW_h8r1eCQ.text: Went here with my son, generous amount if dynamite rolls and he liked the other dish he ordered. I had the speacialtu spider roll(forgot the actual name), it was alrighr. I expected it a little more spicier than it was.

G_QA74exMapZVcTVY--oiA.text: Great place for sushi. It's not as pricey as the other places and they have my favorite white tuna ! We usually order to go and it's always consistent.  Wish they had their sushi roll descriptions online but to make due I took a picture and posted it haha.  Nice staff too! This is definitely our go to sushi place near home.   To try: Agedashi tofu  Spank me roll White tuna sashimi

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Updated rolls

Oc1RyGJUiTnm6csY5xJSgA.text: Sakebomber always has great service and great food, I've yet to find a place better around Tempe.

pZ-7Zo74ZrXr3ZQPuFWGiQ.text: Such a good spot for sushi at a good price that doesn't seem sketchy! The outside of the building is a little rough but once you walk through the front door, you are taken to a quaint sushi bar that looks very clean and modern. The happy hour deals are a college student's dream! Nothing fancy about their rolls or food options, just a dependable, cheaper sushi joint in Tempe.

FyMjHyFzqDDg3y1L9eqgSQ.text: Just went to Saki Bomber for the first time last night with some friends. We ordered a tootsie roll, California crunch roll, and Las Vegas roll. The sushi was so good that both of my friends ordered seconds and I probably would have as well if I could've afforded to be bloated at the time. They both did saki bombs and I had the white sangria. The drinks were good and everything was fairly cheap despite missing happy hour. Really good sushi, I would definitely recommend. The staff was very friendly as well and a few of them came over to talk to us. My only complaint is I wish there were more booths.

rJpcSR10eJJVOAobPM_FlQ.text: Who would have known that in the middle of Tempe there is a great Sushi place. My hubby and I decided to come here on Sunday night for a quick happy hour. We started off with the soft shell crab. Although, I thought it was a little too greasy, by hubby loved every bite. I ordered the salmon sashimi and their house salad. Everything that came out tasted fresh. One of the guys making our sushi asked if we ever tried the fresh wasabi with no horseradish paste. Huh? There is such a thing? I am so glad we tried it because it gave everything we ordered extra flare.  We will be coming back more often and possibly become regulars.

BhZzBrmlIJwR3b3FbHLOrg.text: Good food, but too expensive for what you get in my opinion regarding sushi. The meals were fairly priced. The service was pretty good, but I wouldn't recommend going here for sushi as there are better options for the price.

qHY869-wimW0qCGt1TKTVA.text: Love this place & have loved it since we moved into the neighborhood last year. They know us by name and our order by heart. We always sit in Kane's section & give the owner/manager Rebecca a hug. :)

LYMoQLmZ3x4LkK8zI5GZyg.text: If you're looking for small portions, undercooked rice, and rude service for a good chunk of money, look no further! Ordered the 8 piece salmon sashimi for $10 and the portions were ridiculously small and thin. Didn't eat one piece of it due to skin still being on the underside. Since the salmon sashimi didn't fill me up, I ordered a Philly roll as well. It had very little rice and I could barely taste the smoked salmon due to the heavy amount of avocado and cucumber. As we were leaving, the waitress followed us outside since my partner forgot to sign the second check; however upon seeing that she didn't recive a tip(I had tipped on mine), she scoffed to my partners face. Although the service was good up until that point it, seemed she was more concerned about getting a better tip than making sure we signed so they could run the transaction. We came in with high hopes due to the other reviews and were beyond disappointed. I will say the only complete positive was how nice the woman with short hair and a name tag was, that's all. I suggest going somewhere else if you're looking for a better experience. UPDATE: After about 15 minutes after leaving my partner and I are now feeling very queasy and nauseous, if either of us begin to vomit or cramp, I will be calling the store to let them know there is something wrong with their food/fish.

LnAnEEhypkIsRPSH26YNEA.text: The best time to come here is for happy hour. It's reasonably priced, good service, and casual environment.

1JfVT2oRo5TcX3pULpt_dA.text: First time customer.....daughter's bday choice for sushi. Driven by this place countless times. Never stopped. Who knew? Shame on me!  First...staff knowledge and gracious. From the hostess to our waiter, everyone happy to explain the menu. Place was clean, neat and had no bad fish smell. Love that!  Second the food. Amazing! Favors, textures, presentation and yes, pricing. We hit happy hour. Choices were vast and each plate was so tasty. We hit all the categories and each plate was beautiful in presentation and marvelous on the palate.  Each sauce a perfect match to the plate of food.  Beer selection was impressive and the bar appeared nicely stocked. The mules looked especially inviting but I was enjoying the fresh local beers too much to switch. Someone had to drive! Mules will be my next adventure.  Expected this restaurant to be good.  Didn't expect it to be wow!  It was wow! Our waiter Owen  was superior in service and attention to this novice as he navigated the menu.  We will be back...to try soups, noodles and the long list of rolls and bites we didn't try today.  Seriously a great experience and a wonderful find. Love supporting locally owned businesses. You need to try this place.   Many heart-felt motherly thanks to the entire staff for the wonderful cularinary experience/celebration of my daughter's birthday.

StFiRaWVQwJ4AvA8E9RS1w.text: Wow I was impressed. So much fun, a really busy Saturday night and the sushi and service were spot on. I will definitely go back. Great for a date night, or night out with friends. Excellent value for a pretty great restaurant experience.

9QMmyUVEpbY31n3pisG-rQ.text: Great food and atmosphere. Even during a super busy time, Madison and the other ladies up front make sure everyone in the restaurant is taken care of. Brought my wife and her brother and they both love it here.

R4od8fznUZa5GHyJQmeE5g.text: I experienced awful customer service, inexcusable wait times for my Togo order, and an unapologetic hostess and staff.   After placing an order on the phone, I was quoted 25-35 minutes for my order, which included 4 rolls and 1 garlic edamame. I arrived 40 minutes later and was quoted another 10 minutes until my food was ready. I was given my edamame right away but it was cold. No apologies for the late food or cold appetizer.   A manager then quoted us another 5 minutes, which then became 10. Again, a small apology was made but no efforts to rectify the situation.   I asked for a new order of edamame because ours was cold, after asking several times, the manager (Rebecca) agreed.   In the meantime our food was no where to be found. We eventually got our food an hour and 15 minutes AFTER I placed my order over the phone.   I requested that part of the bill be taken care of and after negotiating back and forth (and the manager claiming she had no power) she finally agreed. She took off the 2 appetizers, eel sauce, and the fresh wasabi. Nothing in comparison to the rude service and late food.   On top of all this the hostess was rude, said the F word to a customer on the phone, and never apologized for the wait. They did offer us free water several times, so I'll give them that.   Mediocre sushi for way to high a price. Not worth the time.  Side note: it was a Sunday evening around 8:45pm and the restaurant was hardly busy.

l6Ckn-AOdXa92QlNaK3hZg.text: What was I thinking...5 Stars. We love you Sakebomber and your prices are our favorites. Thanks for the good drinks, the great sushi and being a nice local sushi bar.

MT-9z8D1mhnEgXYl8IzoWQ.text: SakeBomber offers some of my favorite sushi in the valley and my rating is a generalization of probably a dozen visits to the restaurant over the past several years.      Their sashimi is consistently of good quality, and their rolls are both creative and tasty, with a generous selection to choose from.  Finally, they have a wide selection of Asian beers and Sakes to choose from plus of course a full bar.     The atmosphere is typically lively and service has always been good.     If you're into sushi, you like to enjoy a few sake bombs with your Asahi, Kirin, Orion, etc, and you enjoy a nice lively atmosphere, SakeBomber is a great option!

zGJN6N0KpJSd11k-E_j_ew.text: Having a family trip after my graduation, we decide to have a dinner in this place! Best Sushi Grill restaurant I have ever tried!!!   "Evil" is my favorite !!!!!  ,Tempe!!,,nice!,!!!!!!!!  "Evil" !

oUF-qD5Yv-JfohwgM4jJxw.text: Overall ok. Their sushi is a little plain to me. I have also gotten a few of their meals and nothing sticks out as outstanding. There's is much better places in town for sushi and Japanese food.

NCwGB5HBM7qY05ctk497wg.text: Best lunch specials and sashimi around. Love this place.  Can be on the slow side for lunch service unless you say you only have 30 minutes. Great food.

xWSa7l4UipZl8yqG8JQ5zQ.text: Nice and clean atmosphere. Broad sushi and hot food menu. Great happy hour selections. Lots of creative rolls, but none I had were particularly outstanding. We ordered the Juicy Roll, Sunshine Roll, and Volcano rolls. The nigiri was pretty good for the price. We also had hamachi kama, the bomb crab puffs, and the soft shell crab. The soft shell crab has a heavier breading but was still very good.
