9aRNLtE9T78I4M6bOzTnxg.text: I came here for my birthday week on a Saturday. It was a pretty cool place when I first walked and the girl at the front desk was really gorgeous looking, Which then gave me a good start of the night. I enjoyed the sushi there which were you're typical sushi like any other place. I also orders a garlic shrimp on a skewer which too was pretty tasty. The only bad experience I would have to be that our waitress was a little forgetful and slow which was a bit annoying but after a few sake shots, it didn't bother me much anymore. The lighting at the place was a a bit gloomy as well. I understand it is trying to make you feel that dim and romantic like feeling but for me it was making me sleepy along with the rest of my party. I would add this to my list of ok sushi places.

sG06Z4THuGCnoQULHspdMA.text: I'd do 3.5 stars if I could. Pretty good rolls, pretty good drinks.  Enjoyed the enchilada roll and playboy roll. Wife got drunk.

AMyGUNhe_FNKlk4xtRPJjQ.text: revisted this place, and honestly... it was exactly what I was looking for.  A place to kick back with some friends and have some sushi instead of deep fried everything from other places.  The sushi was well rolled, the wait staff was friendly, the chefs interact with you and if they don't, it's probably cause they're concentrating on making sushi haha.  I like how people show up at restaurants at 945 when they close at 10 and then B about it... get a life, cause obviously the chefs and their families have one.  And why are you watching monkeys masturbate anyways... sick nasty, get a life.  Eat at Sake Bombers more and maybe the chefs will invite you to chill after work.

xEBC2AZGnPyuuAiQAVos2A.text: The food here is awesome. For the people that dont understand Japanese FUSION. This is the ultimate fusion place. They have authentic Japanese taste and some fussed with their own twist. I ordered Last Vegas roll and Spicy eel Yummm. Their home made habanero sauce (I know... weird right, but creative) is to die for if you are a spicy lover. Would def come here again. Now I want to go back just thinking about it.

JtXXO2R4kBhoefUEfi01fA.text: The sushi pictures on yelp looked so great, I thought, let's give it a try!  Enter restaurant, the hostess accosts us and belts, "Who's drinking?"  I look at my fifteen year old son and say, "Well, I am."  She then pinions us to the entrance way with a seemingly mandatory recitation of the specials and some other stuff and when I am just about to ask her to, please, just show us to our table, she finishes.  The decor is mostly black, and the kind of bar lighting that makes you wonder what might be crawling on the floor - kind of revamped, trendy, fraternity house grunge.  The center of the table we sat at had a thick, sticky, old, oily surface on that I didn't think they could get up without solvents so I just put a napkin on top so my arms wouldn't stick to it.  They brought a glass container with a candle in it that was covered in oily smudges and bits of food.  I mean really - it was disgusting.  Ordered tempura appetizer that was seeping with oil - the antithesis of good tempura.  California roll, ok.  Son had beef and veggies with soba noodles, except they forgot the veggies.  We eat nori rolls frequently and have been making our own for years, so we are not new to the concept.  The juicy roll I ordered was not as decribed by the server, who was, nevertheless, very attentive and pleasant and did refund us for the roll.   Also had some kind of "western" roll with chicken and an inedible hot sauce, without which, the roll had no flavor at all.  The Creme Brulee was good.  I hated this place.  For more than $80 we could have had a really nice dinner somewhere.

4eA5jSkeazw5AkKyrioOmQ.text: My family and I come here when the visit from out of town. The sushi is sooo good. If you don't know what to get, I recommend the rainbow roll. The desserts are pretty good, too. Overall: good service and good food. I have yet to be disappointed out of the five or so times I've been there.

3lsU4b1b-iaHEPcMcgkY0w.text: I have to say we heard amazing things about this sushi place, before we tried it. I have to say this was the worst, most horrendous sushi i have ever eaten in my entire life. I tried the stuffed shrimp appetizer and it was dry and zero flavor. My friend had the calamari and it was soggy and chewy. Not only were the appetizers horrible the sushi was appealing. The playboy roll was dry and the spicy tuna on top tasted off. The Tasty Tuna roll was iffy. I probably should have just sent it all back but we were starving. Well we all learned our lesson later that night. I spent a half hour throwing up because the sushi/food made me sick and i know my friends also spent their nights in close proximity to a bathroom. Honestly, I would not eat here unless you are looking to get sick.

t9gGnPf2I7kNkANp0d39Pw.text: I placed a to-go order on a Tuesday night while barley anybody was there & waited 35 minutes to get my food.  This was my first time eating their sushi so I was pretty excited and didn't care about the wait.  Unfortunately, the sushi was oddly warm and the tuna was slimy.  For the price I paid (including a 10% gratuity fee for take-out), I expected way better.  I felt sick for days even just thinking about how un-fresh the sushi and fish products were.  I can't see myself going back, just stick to RA..or hell, even Whole Foods sushi is delicious.

6re_pWDZA_rW1hc5X4nKYw.text: I understand that the intended vibe was classy, cool, and modern, though I really felt like I was in a cave. The decor is dark, red and black walls, and the place has poor lighting. The service was friendly, but slow and the table we sat at was....sticky. Now, getting onto the food,  it wasn't the best quality sushi, and I have had many philly rolls in my day. Long story short, SakeBomber was not my cup of tea. (no pun intended.)

5A5KxbLFr1K-r3_ZdT9-7A.text: I have never had a bad experience here, they have good lunch specials and happy hour.  The wait staff is always very friendly and helpful. The tootsie maki is one of my favorite rolls here, and the interior decorations are pretty.

4-hZmksJP9C6MqCRfpilyA.text: still one of my favorites!  quick tip: order the lollipop roll. it's delicious and creative.

-Wtkw4ZrfH3PN082GQNkMA.text: WARNING-strictly a happy hour review. I ordered the Alaskan rolls, Boston rolls, and the California rolls. Holy cow-SO GOOD! All of the ingredients were fresh and full of flavor. I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs gave us a ceviche dip, which was deliciously tangy and complimented the Boston rolls perfectly. I absolutely LOVED this restaurant's happy hour and I will definitely be back for the delicious food.

tcDInvSgtHUu62QvBr3sYQ.text: I'm so glad I live basically right next to this place. I am from Seattle where the sushi is pretty great. I thought that being out here in Arizona it would be difficult to find a place that even comes close to Seattle sushi, but I was proven other wise. My friends and I got several different rolls; Las Vegas, Spicy tuna, Caterpillar, and Crispy Eel rolls were all good! We got another one that I think was a 'special' for the day and that was the only one that I didn't really like. Needless to say, I'm a fan of this place.

V-MTfd6sQm1DX2ieAnMT5w.text: The place was a fun atmosphere and the people working there were great too. The place has reverse happy hour so I enjoyed $2 Sake. Sushi was pretty good too. I'd definitely go back.

OrEjIJKlq0t2YzewLIjrGQ.text: When I was a sophomore in college (okay, not forever long ago, but a few years), this was a known place in the surrounding area of campus that didn't card...which for some people was a very enticing idea, so there were many an event held there (mostly clubs and orgs that had both 21+ and underage members).  Now if you want to drink at Sake Bomber's, you had better be ready to get carded at the door and wear a wristband for the night.  Its totally not a big deal (if you're over 21), and probably a smart move on their part business-wise so they don't get busted.  The sushi at Sake Bomber's is decent--its not over-the-top amazing, and certainly not bad.  This place does go a little over the top on selections though.  There are so many rolls, appetizers, specials, dinners, to choose from--its a little intense, and perhaps overwhelming for the indecisive order-er.  The prices are average for sushi.  The ambiance is a cross between a lounge and a sports bar.  Sake Bomber probably isn't your best bet for sushi in Tempe, and certainly not in all of the Phoenix Metro Area, but its a good place to go when you want to mix it up in Tempe (maybe you've been going to Sushi 101 every night) or for big groups.

vqFmPDKwpQpKmAWOpM13jw.text: "Only been here once but my husband and I both enjoyed the sushi and service. We look forward to trying all the different rolls. Great selection and a knowledgable server!"

-PaIhDx-HUDtHaMN2TxrJA.text: Update : quality is still great but a bit pricy for the college pocket. Service was awesome and I love their fried calamari with the fried jalapenos .... yum yum

2XBlrr7zDYV1-NcZTueJ4g.text: Been here a couple times with the BF, and I have no complaints...get the Killer Shrimp, it is my FAVORITE! Nice staff, and now the happy hour is like all afternoon/evening! Pretty rad.

pz-X_tTq3gwfVeS-s60c8A.text: Great food, great atmosphere, friendly service, a great place to hangout at happy hour too.

-tqAL2Zer8fqALgiVY1AMg.text: Quite impressed. Sushi was fresh. Drinks were reasonable. Got the lunch combo in addition to the Las Vegas roll(which is delightful)... Feel free to try it. Other than that it was pretty good. Not a whole lot of complaints as I usually have at least a few. Give it a whirl.

9XxmrF6o6RjVkwNezKfLeA.text: This is my favorite sushi place!  The 'Spank Me' roll is the best thing in the world.

QF_UJ6P600M6JeM_z5xB0Q.text: I couldn't imagine worse, more poorly timed service. Food was brought out at staggered intervals as our group of 6 ate their food separately. An hour and a half wait for sushi?! Absolutely unacceptable.

0s_wfOoGlwffidlckXWjaw.text: Just had my first experience at Sakebomber! My boyfriend and i got the chicken scewers, rainbow row, cali roll, crunchy cali roll, catepillar and tootsie. The catepillar roll and the crunchy cali were average. Everything else was AWESOME. I highly recommend the rainbow roll, and their cali rolls were pretty impressive as well. Tootsie roll was fantastic. Overall it was a good experience. Much better sushi than raw, but still not my favorite place overall. Best place was Zen 32.   OH and go during happy hour! Otherwise, it could get a bit expensive.

hGtzu0y0iIlsa32KLWfykg.text: The sushi was delicious! price was pretty reasonable as well. The service could have been a bit better, but other than that, everything was to my liking :) The atmosphere was nice too.

nQPUQuE49VxYGvtgKwrkYg.text: Hands down, best sushi place I've ever been to. Customer service is always a must have with me and this place is all about it! Have had every server (been there that much) and they are all friendly, know the menu, and recommend the best specials! The sushi is amazing, don't be afraid to ask what's good that day because the chefs know what's up!! Atmosphere is never a let down. You find yourself conversing with the boss in no time, which makes you feel really welcome :)

owr-80SWvTCiqBzwraamwQ.text: When I first moved into my place in Tempe, I took a good look around the neighborhood and I saw a Thai place, a coffee shop of death, A decent taquieria, Ted's Hot Dogs and SakeBomber Sushi & Grill. I thought I was set. There was even a Native New Yorker for all the Natives to conveine at. I thought I was SET!  I ventured across the street to sakebomber. It doesn't look like much from the outside but when you get inside, it's dark and modern and what some aging hipster thought was cool. The menu is varied and the sushi selection is the usual suspects. It's average sushi. Nothing to write yelp about. But I did like the Chicken Katsu. I haven't been here in a bit, but it's okay.   For the sushi novices, I think this is a perfect place to get used to the flavors of sushi. But for the sushi master, this place will not do... maybe in a pinch but with an even better sushi joint one block south, it's not worth it. I say go with friends who want to try out sushi.

xvn63tK_LcXWTYD1JPpCIQ.text: I really like the fact that I can get a draft IPA at a sushi joint. The contrasting flavors in the"kiss my bass" roll are so satisfying I lack the words to describe it adequately. The fish is fresh and the rolls are creative. Oh and be sure to try the infused sakes. Get the flight so you can try a few.

2tBxOQwXgwrfVSyWpLNO9g.text: Nice laid back atmosphere, friendly staff and yummy veggie rolls. Get them tempura fried and you'll be in heaven.  Love sitting at the bar and chatting with the sushi chefs.  :)

dcCTFyjIizMfpwzWN0uiJQ.text: We went to eat at Sake bomber on a friday for happy hour, we had the tootsie roll, lollipop, stuffed shrimp and gyoza. The total for the bill was $37.00. I dont consider this to be happy hour prices, I could of gone to Kona and it would of been a nicer atmosphere, and better food for about the same price if not less. The stuffed shrmp and the gyoza was good, nothing that is a must have and the rolls were not rolled thight enough. We saw that they had a special for $20 pitcher of sangria. Thank goodness we asked for a sample becasue it didnt look anything like the picture(picture shows red and we got yellow sangria) and it didnt taste good at all. Overall I wouldnt go back, unless as group of friends wanted to go to happy hour and were set on this place.

ak9vAVbUK4LHokevhviV7A.text: We've been going to SakeBomber for a long time now, and we've always found the sushi and the atmosphere very serviceable.   I love the Fiesta Roll. It's got the perfect blend of fresh fish with a spicy kick, without overwhelming the flavor of the fish. One of the more unique rolls on the menu.   Eric and Steve, the head sushi chefs, always make great sushi, and are willing to go off the menu if you ask them to (provided it's not too busy).   The bar is average at best. Stick to sakebombers, straight shots, or just beer. The mixed drinks are over-priced and under-poured. They look nice, but they don't get the job done.   Overall, SB's is a great place to get good sushi at reasonable prices.

r7j8hrrN8IEYYHtBGA3nQA.text: Went here for my birthday, over all great experience. Lots if good food here , we shared fried rice, clam miso soup and a bunch of rolls

LWQuLPt00Yg33ReeZuQ5Kw.text: LOVE this place, never disappoints! Crispy Cali, and Tempura shrimp are my two favorite rolls. Great assortment of appetizers. Happy Hour/ Reverse Happy Hour is perfect for nights out with friends

T_nUBY9G6olrouDGfOMchg.text: This place was suggested by a trusted friend...i wasn't disappointed in taste / quantity / quality, however I do think it was a little pricey.  I'll be back FOR SURE, but will spend a little less cash.

LJr0x95X_qtlAKuIkutUkg.text: OMG! this place is awesome! the service, the food and everything is just great! I love this place

MIzyp3gPfuRJTqW76dlnJg.text: Awesome sushi! My girlfriend and myself have made this one of our favorite places, literally been there 3 times in the past 4 days. Great boba too!!

x4JfcJuhfG-YNG2lizqNoA.text: Great vibe and love the Nagori cold sake and Kirin light cheers!

T4jvXLeDxnYPNkw-hauy2g.text: The Rolls are fantastic! My girlfriend (who loves Sushi even more than I do) says that SakeBomber has the best in the valley, and she may be right. Since she's the expert, we went with some of her favorite signature rolls, and a cucumber salad. All the picks were top notch. If you like your food with a spicy kick, go for the Playboy roll. It was awesome. The prices are very reasonable and it also wasn't too crowded.  We arrived just before 7:00 on a Friday night and were immediately seated.  While the food is fantastic, the place itself is full of negatives.  The good news is none of them are big enough to stop me from coming back, but here are some of them:   The first question by the hostess after asking how many are in our party was 'will you be drinking tonight?' Turns out she cards you, then gives you a wristband. While I can understand that later at night (during reverse happy hour), I'm not a fan of having to eat my dinner at 7pm wearing a cheap piece of paper on my arm.  SakeBomber's decor looks more like it's trying to be a Sushi bar.  Not quite the upscale look most go for, but they went for the poor man's try.  That may actually be a plus now that i think about it.  You can dress down at this Sushi bar and not feel out of place.  They also don't take American Express (my card of choice). Who doesn't take AmEx in this day and age?

BtOwIY9S-n_PprhVCkpeAg.text: I'm not a sushi expert by any stretch, but suffice to say that the rolls here are well-priced, fresh-tasting, and overall pretty damn delicious, with good presentation.   I'm not a fan of their tea, but that's just a personal preference, I think. I enjoy the Las Vegas, but the Spank Me roll was really good as well. We usually mix and match our way around, and right now they're running a "happy day" 4pm-9pm special on a lot of their rolls which makes them cheaper by $1-$3, each. Definitely worth it.  Good service, laid back vibe, even if the decor is a little "college dorm" with the lighting, but overall, fun, good food, and affordable.

wwUea9WaC2b2W08LvQfK2w.text: I apologize to my fellow yelpers, but anyone who doesn't give this place 5 stars is out of their mind.  I am a Southern California native, I KNOW good sushi, and this is by far the best place in Tempe to go.  I am willing to say it's the best sushi I've had while living in Arizona.  These rolls are not like the skimpy ones you'll find at Ra and they're cheaper, especially during happy hour.  I will say that a lot of the rolls are spicy, and I love spicy, so that could be why I am obsessed with Sakebomber!  The staff is the best, too!!  If you have not tried this place, and you love sushi, you are definitely missing out!

NsyHUxwyq5CFaiEjwiwoSg.text: Saki bomb it's a nice chill spot the outside u think its dead but there are ppl in there lol It seems they have updated some of the booths but the restroom needs update ASAP! The staff is very friendly and not in a rush to get u out they help you and let u take ur time. I would go back just update the restroom please

4T-hBIwCYpFxwH4EHqCEWg.text: The ladies are SO kind, the chefs are SO on point but let me tell you something. They've created a Thai Boba Tea with... booze. Yes, booze. It's creamy, sweet and checks off on the alcohol cause I'm sure feeling it. Please check it out guys, I've been here 3 times in a week and can't get enough of it. I shall leave it at that, love you SakeBomber! Till next time

qt2hlrSUqBb09lTH8UFLzw.text: Best sushi. Always fresh at a reasonable price. My husband and I have been going here for years and it is still our favorite sushi in the valley. Staff are very friendly and the place is always clean

wqDdRvgwuIRxgHBnarm1tw.text: My absolute favorite Sushi restaurant!!! Playboy and Playgirl rolls! Crazy Spider roll  soft shell crab appetizer, kiss my bass roll. This local restaurant has the highest quality fish and delicious rolls. Plus the service is excellent and the cocktails are A+.  This is where I go for all my sushi cravings!

68tqLW-FzxLcqwKqnGgLfQ.text: Went to this place with friends and adored it the first time, went again with family, just as good. They're wonderfully consistent. They're dinner plates are a solid portion of food, I left full as all heck. And their boba cocktails are super fun.

l_l6YCzeZ1EnPwiDd2HE_Q.text: Ordered sushi take out. Back in the day I was a sushi snob, but that was a while ago. The dish was Fantastic-fresh, great flavor and texture. The sashimi was delicious ~ melt in your mouth good. I admit I was super bummed not to find wasabi in my bag... or ginger to cleanse the palate. But I'm not sure the person that picked it up requested them or not.  So.. if you like those things, remember to ask. There ya go. Free tip;)

VRNiXdbwTCa8HiUU8XMCOA.text: This place was okay. Nothing special. Decent atmosphere and service. Ramen was about average and miso soup was good. Would go back but wouldn't be first choice.

YC5K6k6znzol2pDd-1ndNw.text: Went to SakeBomber after a horrific experience down the street at Junn AYCE Sushi.  Junn has the absolute worst service you could imagine.  So our party of 9 left before ordering and went down the street.    I believe it is a sister team that operates this restaurant, and the good service and delicious food made it clear why they were so much busier than Junn's.    The sushi portions were huge, and the bento box dinners were delicious.    We will be back.  Thank you!!  The folks at Junn Sushi need to take lessons from you on customer service!!!

8hnLtfwrUuvUfVZNMCm8LQ.text: Excellent quality sushi and super tasty soba, plus a price point that is hard to beat. We stumbled across this gem by accident and am happy we did. We had a few rolls that were all expertly made and contained quality ingredients. Friendly and attentive staff, which seems to be a rarity in the valley. All in all a must try.

yepFanK2okpE2cGQVEb3qg.text: Great sushi and an awesome staff, thanks to the cart girl for a great recommendation!!!

tYhE4cFJvjhqFYQENlp7cg.text: Decent sushi. Good happy hour and deals. Started closing earlier which through me off. Use to be a cool late night spot to hit up. But was always a little slow so I guess it makes sense .

KLk22T5cqdKQ8AtpKbJQGA.text: Surprising! Sashimi was tender and served over radish and cucumber. Very tasty. Choice of cold sakes was nice! One even on Happy Hour.  Fried rice dish, sushi, and Yellowtail collar. Wow!

EO3xEpC_ZAM7WzvG4YXiRA.text: Love this place! My fiance and I eat out here often. It's our favorite date place when we don't want to dress up and go far. Great sushi, good deals, and the vibe is awesome. The only thing missing is a patio! The mochi is a must!

ZgQwTQCeJ2TdpAOBGgh9XA.text: Super excited finally trying this place but really confused with the rating on yelp after eating there. We were really excited it was happy hour when we went but only to find out it was more expensive that any happy hour I've ever been too. The sushi tasted like the rice was cooked in sewer water or something other than water. I ordered another roll just to give it other chance thinking it was a bad batch of rice and it was still unsettling. Also they didn't have any of the beer we asked for and finally got a beer close to what we wanted and then over heard the waiter tell the table next to us they were out of the beer we were drinking after 20 minutes. I'm not sure how you run out of 4 different beers that quickly on a slow Tuesday night. Overall had no idea what was in that rice and I don't think I'm going back to find out. Such a bummer!

bO1bcKuihloXZAUgvkhgyg.text: When I'm in the mood for some sushi, this is the only place I'll go. I've tried others but I always leave disappointed. I've made this my go to spot for some great sushi, specials, brews and great service. If you haven't tried this place, you have too.

41CH8XpUS3je7yjZqMO9Gg.text: Went there at night not real busy but service was slow had my credit card for 10 minutes before I got the bill don't like it out of sight that long

kO1r9BfOoz2owq6C_WN17A.text: Don't let the location or exterior of SakeBomber fool you. The eclectic decor and furnishings lend themselves to a fun and somehow still intimate atmosphere. The waitstaff are attentive and efficient, and the food is consistently delicious and fresh. If I didn't already enjoy sashimi, this place certainly would have changed my mind.

ZreDltLiQlLTfpaVQ5sKIA.text: Love this place. Been coming for years and the food is bomb and reasonably priced. The waitresses are also prompt and nice. Love me some tootsie.

Yr1vayAR5Tjso3rnxhbr-w.text: I work in Tempe and a co-worker introduced this place to me years ago for the Sushi.  I'd never eaten Sushi before, but took a chance and I was amazed that I like it.  I only eat cooked Sushi, nothing raw.  I've visited more and more over the years and immediately became a fan of the Beef Yakisoba.  OMG, it is so good with amazing flavor.  The only reason why I knocked off a star is because the serving size is smaller than what you pay for.  I don't believe in eating, but still being hungry afterwards.  If they would increase the serving size a little, I would spend all my money there.

rbWEEQjtAR1vuHPNECPq0A.text: The food was delicious, the pricing is appropriate (especially during happy hour), delicious Japanese Beer and and a calm setting. Definitely will come again.

NOz1fi2SetwRYDhTwt13rg.text: First time here and I was very happy with my meal. My wife doesn't eat sushi instead had a chicken pasta and absolutely hated it but this is my review not hers. Sushi was great, server earned extra points from me and was very helpful.

668rDOx5Cuxj_FMPGGnAVg.text: Great place! Atmosphere was wonderful, service pretty good and sushi was delicious. Not a huge fan if the eel here but the other rolls were terrific!

SEIZarF4tn1RXexwbKCCAQ.text: This place is really more like a 4.5 in my opinion. I just went there tonight for reverse happy hour/ dinner with the BF after both of us having school for around 12 hours today (ugh). We needed a drink. Well, we decided on Sakebomber because it is close to our house and because the place we were originally going to try (Saketini) didn't have reverse happy hour until ten. Anyway, I'm glad we gave this place a shot. It looked a little sketchy from the outside, but the inside was nice and comfortable. We got ID'd at the door and given bracelets, which was a bit weird, but fine with me. Also, the hostess was a really sweet girl, so it made it less weird. We were sat, and our awesome waitress, Joy, came by to get drink orders fairly quickly. The BF got a beer (asaki... I think) and I got the Bahama Mama on Joy's recommendation. They cost 4 and 5$ respectively. My drink was wonderful! It was all banana-y and coconutish and just delicious.   So we ordered cucumber rolls, gyoza, spring salad, and the chimichanga rolls. The BF liked the cucumber rolls (I didn't try them), The gyoza were clearly generic gyoza, but at least this place had good sauce and they were crispy, which was pleasant. The salad was alright, a bit too peppery, but good and fresh tasting.   So chimichanga rolls you may ask. They are rolls that have fried chicken (True story), avocado, jalapeno, rice, cream cheese, wrapped in seaweed and then the whole thing is fried and served with habanero sauce. This sounds like a food eaten on dare or thought up by a very drunk person. Good for them, though, because these were wonderful!!!! I have never enjoyed a sushi roll, mainly because I do not usually like the flavor of seaweed, but it was a lot more subtle in this roll (probably due to the deep fry) and I really liked them. The sauce was super yummy!   So we eat all of our food.....all of it..... and are still nursing our drinks, when Joy comes over and says 'oh, you're still drinking, would you like me bring you some free toasted marshmallows... I thought I heard wrong, but I did hear free, so I said.... ok..... She brought out these delicious toasted marshmallows on whipped cream with strawberry sauce. It was great!... albeit very weird.   The whole meal (two alcoholic drinks, gyoza, two sushi rolls, a salad, and a dessert) cost 30$. Overall, this place was great and I will most definitely be back with as many people as I can introduce to this great place!  Update: Went back tonight for a 'snack' and for the BF's dinner. Got the chimichanga roll..... Even better than last time, if that's possible! The more habanero sauce... the better! We also split the tempura ice cream.... Also super delicious. It's ice cream wrapped in cake and then fried with chocolate sauce and whipped cream on top.... yes it is as delicious as it sounds.  Oh... we had Joy again, and she rocks my socks! Probably the coolest waitress I've ever met, so major props on that!

BnrboZQa7xn5OF-L_8R3-Q.text: Great service; interesting and very inventive rolls that all presented great flavor combinations.

aUrtkfEetZ0q6HHKokQNEA.text: Went here because of the Yelp reviews, was definetly not impressed. The atmosphere is dark like a bar, the food is below average. Sushi tasted like it had been sitting around for a while. I would NOT recommend this place.

jM5TG_DQOoLIp7FEPCTTvA.text: Very expensive for what you get, slow service a real disappointment.     If you love sushi this is not the place to go try it you will see.

lYBEkq-ZaNtU18tszHT6ww.text: This is my favorite sushi place in the valley.   My daughter and I went and had numerous rolls and a few drinks and were very happy with the price. The service was great.   I'll be going back ... soon!

dShL_txICMLslYHAyPnqEQ.text: Sake Bomber is an amazingly beautiful restaurant that is perfectly situated just off ASU campus. They do an age check upon entrance for anyone that wants to drink specifically because they are close to ASU which is understandable if not slightly cheesy for an upscale place. I presume they dont do it at the table in order to speed up service. However as this is a SUSHI (Fish) restaurant I will not spend time analyzing their liquor which was perfectly fine but not super awesome.  Sake Bomber gets a lot of traffic for 2 reasons. 1) they have a very good reputation and 2) they are around alot of ASU students but not on campus. This may mean they go through a sizable amount of fish per day and sometimes it is not always the best/freshest fish. This is what happened to us last night.  I want to say upfront that AAron our server was exceptional. The food came out fast and that was a great plus to this place which is why it has 3 stars.  I ordered salmon roll..it's not on the menu but it is a simple roll I like to order to see the quality of fish before I order a more elaborate roll. I also ordered 2 salmon nigiri presumably made from the same batch of salmon. In both cases the salmon was not a quality cut nor a quality taste. It wasnt spoiled, rotten or off color but it also was not cold/crisp and delicious. The nigiri was slimy and shredded, not a solid piece of salmon.   Now you may think I am over analyzing this and you would be correct. This was going inside my body and also taste is important when it comes to sushi. I would drive extra for great sushi than just get inexpensive stuff around the corner. This was neither inexpensive nor great. It was good but it wasnt awesome.  5 people = $125.00 . Yes my friends did get sake and it was not all happy hour ordering..but it was expensive compared to other places. I presume we are paying for the decor and ambiance more than the actual fish. Perhaps they should rename the place "SakeBomber - We have Fish Too" and then the expectation level wont be so high.  ps the 4 TV's in the dining room were a distraction. I think TV's should be kept at the bar not places throughout the eating area.

XqSjPa44EgHHl19g6NKZTg.text: Fresh tasty sushi, great atmosphere, delicious drinks and a courteous staff, what more could anyone ask for?

jZAHH_MWaau_eLojkZm1sw.text: This place seems to attract a younger crowd, but its pretty dang good. They do a couple of special sauces like "Japanese salsa" and  another with chipotle sauce that rock. Chef's are nice and laid back.

nuSZc5tJ1sRe4lWTmyi5kQ.text: Its okay, The sushi is good, but there rice is kind of hard. Being an asian person and living in Los Angeles, I have to say this is not as good as sushi in NYC or LA.  It is way better than sushi 101.  And way better than the franchise Kabuki

TWXUrvZ6LQI5mh7LDFi1bQ.text: This place is great! I'm from California and use to good sushi. This place definitely impressed me.  Great staff and sushi. The happy hour is really a plus. They take care of you for sure. Differently recommend if you are searching for good sushi in AZ.

HF6UY6Oplre1g50lYiHz1A.text: I had an Excellent experience here and the server Eric was great. Not only was he super knowledgeable but he was more then personable. The sushi was fresh and full of flavor. They had a Taki special and omg it was Amazing! I haven't had sushi this good in the states.

TO-iWO7lkcdq-u_UWPWCfA.text: the only reason I cant give this a 5 star is because I am a ridiculously picky eater & also dont eat sushi. My friend & I randomly stopped here for lunch the other day. Decor is clean, & nice. The waiter, very nice & helpful, & on point with everything. The food was good, large portions & great lunch prices. My friend, who is a sushi eater, said his lunch was DELICIOUS.

-PCGcLnABbTd-c9JoZoefQ.text: GREAT service! Very clean and chill atmosphere. Sushi was sooooo good! I will be visiting this place again

2YwyMSjDFVtnSQn7LYIUBQ.text: Let me start by saying that I have been reading almost every review on here about this place, and have been chomping at the bit to try it.   Arrived there with my wife, and two daughters. We did not get Joy as a server, I made sure to check their names. I think she was off in the middle of the day, maybe working nights only.   Anyway, we sat down and the two girls that sat us/served us were very nice and friendly. I give three stars just for them being cool. I looked over the sushi menu, and all but three (I think) rolls were listed as spicy. I do not eat anything spicy. I am weird, yes I know, but I want to taste every flavor in my food rather than burn my mouth so I can guess if it is good or not. I ordered the Las Vegas roll, and requested regular salmon instead of baked salmon along with nothing spicy at all please. Also ordered the baked scallop roll. We got our older daughter the lunch special of Teriyaki beef, and our newborn we got some hot water to make her a bottle :P (she's one month old). The beef came out first, and all three of us tried a piece. It did not taste that great, and not much flavor to it at all. I ate the miso soup instead. Next came the Las Vegas roll, in which the plate had six super slim pieces of sushi with jalapenos on them.  I was pretty upset, but figured I would pull them off and hope my mouth didn't get burned from jalapeno juice left on the rice. I didn't taste anything spicy, but wow my mouth had this horrible taste of baked salmon. I believe it was fresh, so please don't think it was bad but I just can't stand that weird taste of baked salmon. I gave the rest of the roll to my wife, and told her I would help eat what she couldn't of the next roll. Out comes the baked scallop roll, and this thing is huge. I mean it covered the entire plate. I was very impressed, and thought they totally redeemed themselves. I took a piece, and it tasted like pieces of no flavor fish on a California roll. I do mean absolutely no flavor. I asked my wife to try it so I could know if it was my taste buds or not, and she had the same result. I told her I didn't want to eat any more of it, and was very disappointed about the food. So my wife, being the good girl she is, ate that roll also so it wouldn't go to waste. I couldn't believe it, we paid almost $25.00 for something that Teharu sushi sells for $3.00, and they have a ton of flavor when it's fresh.   If you have eaten here, and think my story is bogus, then don't worry because I am very picky when it comes to sushi. I am still looking for good sushi like I have had in northern California.   So as if the food was not bad enough, the cooks did the same thing as another yelper mentioned. They started changing, and turned off the lights around where we were. The servers were still nice and friendly, but wow it felt like a "hint hint. . . . . Get out now!!" from the cooks.  So breakdown: 3 stars = Service from the girls 1 star   = Food -2 stars = the cooks not getting the order right, and being pushy for us to leave.

YLKxmvQUnXDnerKGCfl2rw.text: Me and the husband usually go for their "reverse happy hour." I'm pretty happy with the pricing and with the overall quality of the food. Yeah they do make you wear a 21+ wristband, but I don't blame them trying to keep their liquor license.   I'm definitely a fan of the spicy tuna rolls and the crispy california. They're both amazing and decently priced; around $3-4.50 per roll during reverse happy hour. $4 kirin's, $5 mixed drinks... Their reverse happy hour is 9-close.

2wjJrQRknyuOuTjIU-VmdA.text: On all fronts.. food, atmosphere, service, drinks... SakeBombers is just okay... and that might even be stretching the truth.    The sushi is sub-par as are the cocktails.  They do have lots of happy hour and reverse happy hour specials but they are again... mediocre.  Considering that I can walk here from my house and stumble home if need be... I still would rather go eat/drink at MANY other places instead.    The volcano roll is not very spicy as it is claimed to be and the wings are a bit soggy.    The atmosphere leaves much to be desired... Its like they didn't know if they were going for the asian theme or for a more swanky cool vibe... and they ended up in this bad middle ground that leaves you feeling confused.

zbHEGS3j3LuUw7wqUtFINg.text: I lived across the street from here for several years and have been countless times. If you are in the area then give this place a go. There is pretty much always happy hour or reverse happy hour going on so the prices are decent. Their food isn't anything to rave about, but it's good for the price.  Service is very spotty. The worst service I have ever had has been here (and if that was my first visit I would not have been back), but usually it is average and sometimes it's great.

ep2RyJSM4-zaiitPwjWOVQ.text: Great sushi! I love the salmon dynamite roll and the crab people roll! The also have a great selection of sake.

JH2SUqbYgqS5ZV5Zzp5ovQ.text: Sakibomers has a long, rich history as the sushi-party place in Tempe. Prior to the current location on Broadway W of McClintock, the sushi hangout was on University W of McClintock.  All the history is unimportant unless you were around experiencing this prime-time party magic "back in the day".  Can you say "saki-bomb"?

2n_CywaK2cn0xj1MCvMZMw.text: I went here for happy hour to watch some MNF. Quiet place with good service and decent beer selection. I got the spicy tuna and volcano rolls and they were pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

dXvCdNmH6T2T-GQEz8VhqA.text: This was my first time coming here and my experience was wonderful.  The food was AMAZING!!! It was easy to tell that our Sushi was made with love and pride The Signature drinks were an unusual blend of Boba, Sake, Bailey's and such, but it all worked and blended together nicely.  Try the Ladybug! It's the drink our Server suggested and it was spot on.  This place opened at 5pm today and was jumping by 545.  The eclectic mix of people, the music, and the sports TV was like having great sushi at a great bar/club.

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

u87dE4NhxZfmyi5WGd8dXw.text: Our son recommended this place to us when we visited him in Mesa.   I had the chicken teriyaki dinner plate.   Not too bad.  Our son had his usual plates of different sushi brought to the table.  He said it was great.   The inside decor looks very nice.... at least at night it did.  Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Back menu page
Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Front menu page

hM2wKcjpE7mkJAZxtVgZJA.text: Don't be fooled by the name, this is a great place for sushi. They have the best yellowtail and salmon in the area and the have a different special sushi roll every day! I recommend this place over any other in Tempe for sushi.

UFt5ynsiFqcpNpBh0BOOCw.text: After having stopped by this place's parking lot plenty of times, it was time to see what was actually inside.  The exterior definitely belied the expansive interior of this place. There was ample room in the entrance, plenty of dining tables, and even an area to lounge about for larger parties.  The atmosphere was definitely inviting. Our waitress was kind, cordial and prompt. It was surprisingly busy, late on a Sunday afternoon. They had a fair amount of patrons just enjoying their meals.  Speaking of meals, we ordered the Bento Combo, along with some soup.  The Bento Combos were quite delectable. The chicken and the beef were quite flavorful, and properly season. But, we did have some quibbles about some of the side items we ordered.  The soups were bland and lackluster. I am not sure how long they had been sitting in a pot, but their main ingredients seemed to have departed for the bottom a while back ago. It would have been nice to have seen a bit more sea weed and tofu, plus the seasoning just wasn't flavorful enough.  The Gyoza was overdone, and quite hard. The meat was okay inside, but the tough exterior didn't make it enjoyable. The small side salad seemed a bit wilted, and there was far too much dressing on top. However, the accompanying rice was quite delightful.  All in all, the experience wasn't bad, we likely will be back again if only for the nice service and the atmosphere.

Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

McYpB2lufx7o88MVjztStQ.text: Great food, nice ambiance. Staff was very friendly. Will definitely be returning with more friends next time around .

Z9uaVvZHPLVhZT-7brj9Wg.text: Hair in one of the ramen plates we ordered. Our order was mixed up and the wrong food was brought out for one person in our party. When we told the server about these two issues, she made a face, argued that we had ordered that specific dish and took the food back. We had been to this place once before and it was a party of 6. Tip was optional or voluntary, but this time we had an 18% gratuity added to our check. I don't mind when establishments do this, but this time, they did not deserve it. We had a bad experience with a hair in our food, the wrong plate being brought out and still we have to pay someone a tip for being rude?? Definitely never coming back.

Z1LDHQe3frAuWRkix0aFAw.text: Great sushi.  We were in a rush and the staff made an exception to accommodate us making it the ASU gammage in time for the show.  Was super great that they were so friendly.  Drinks were great.  Try the white sangria.

nTrKJV9E-3RZPIs3ivwR7A.text: This place is so amazing. The food always tastes delicious and fresh and the staff is always very nice. They recently even added Boba Tea drinks to their menu and the manager was handing out free samples to tables to allow people to try it prior to purchase. I've been here multiple times with my boyfriend and I have to say that they've never disappointed. A few times when they've been really busy the service might be a little slow, but they at least continue to check up on you and give you updates on your food and such, which to me is very important. Things happen, but at least address the issue, don't pretend like it's not there. Highly recommend this place. The varieties of rolls are amazing. I highly recommend the "White Castle" or "Crab People" and always make sure to check out what their special roll of the day is as it usually is also quite amazing!!!

8OxoXEOfSrUBkUOO_tHZKg.text: this is my favorite Tempe local sushi restaurant!   great sushi quality and, friendly staff

uWNhAcp4_5BeF4GcsCVPew.text: Great customer service and lots of options on what you want. There is a lunch menu that is reasonable 2 rolls for $13 and other options besides sushi if that's not your thing. Sat at the bar and they serve more than sake ( don't let the name fool you)  Several regulars come here since the staff greeted them by name. A low key place that has great food

rXt92a35VUx8ObC3HYuxMw.text: SakeBomber was so much fun. Warning: I found out sake bombs have a similar effect as tequila. But other than that we had a lil spread of eel and salmon nigiri, something called an orange blossom roll and a rainbow roll. We couldn't even finish. And our waiter was adorable and super sweet. It wasn't that packed on a Thursday night so it was a perfect date spot.   Date Rating: 5 out of 5. This Rating could be sake induced but idc. Eli looks nerdy cute with his wayfarer style glasses and studious haircut but he's devious. He talked about being the baby of the family and getting away with murder while I whined about being the oldest and basically a martyr for my younger siblings. He likes to rock climb and promised to teach me how to snowboard if I wanted. We planned our next date and he told me I'd love his lazy little puppy. I typically hate PDA so you can imagine my embarrassment when the hostess had to tell us that they were closing in order to get us to quit making out in our booth lmfao

4tRiPBMFG8Yu3C8wAj6qtw.text: Angie, Rebecca and Julissa were amazing, kind and made the night one to remember. The service was excellent and the sushi was delicious!   It was Angie's birthday - she came over to my daughter and me to give us a slice of her delicious birthday cake.   It was my daughter's birthday on Halloween and we went to Sake Bombers to celebrate. They still remembered us and were so thoughtful and sweet! This is my daughter's and my all time favorite restaurant!

813P_-mL5X5y3VO52t_-wQ.text: One of my boyfriend and I's favorite sushi spot in AZ (which says a lot cause we live near the coast in Oregon). GET REAL WASABI and TIP THE SUSHI CHEF'S! They are a strong crew and treat you right. Happy hour is lit on prices and seriously all the delicous sushi looks creative and fun, too. Nice to go to a sushi spot that isn't pretentious!  P.S. Only down side (and I won't dock the review for it but you should know) is that the staff is so light-handed that we have to wait for a seat even so 1/2 the restaurant is open (can't even order a beer while waiting). Would love an update here as I understand needing to wait for the server/bartender (been in the industry most of my adult life), but also the manager or host should let you order something while you wait. Also, if you sell shirts you should have them in stock! We've been trying to buy a pair all year long.

RFVM4SjfwjXD9mc22uHsvA.text: My Husband and I LOVE Saki Bombers- we've been coming here on and off for years, and the fact that we still get recognized is a testament to the amazing staff. We always sit at the Sushi Bar and are welcomed with friendly and passionate people.The Chefs are awesome and are always accommodating- even giving us some extra sauces that they personally recommend. I highly recommend Saki Bombers !!!! I strongly suggest you try the weeknight special the Sensei Roll. It's cry worthy. Here's a picture. Thanks Saki Bombers!!

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wednesday (?) Night&#39;s Special- The Sensei Roll

ZTJQ44jmWPbYA9JMtdZ0nA.text: When my co worker suggested we try her favorite local sushi place after 10 hr work shift.. count me in! Walking into SakeBomber their are signs with few features for night which immediately capture your attention. The restaurant was busy with normal Saturday fair amount of people but we were sat right away at booth.   Service: Our sever came right over with waters to introduce herself and ask if we wanted anything else to drink. We put in our orders with sushi  rolls to start. My friend recommended Salmon Dynamite roll. It's a California roll with cooked salmon/ crab mix on top.. I think the three of us ate that roll so fast!   Sushi rolls: We ordered a total of 4 rolls, Salmon Dynamite, Shrimp Tempura, Sunshine and Caterpillar rolls. All very good rolls.   Drinks: I got the Thai tea.. I would recommend maybe sticking with soft drink or sake. My friends got hot sake and green tea but reported very good.   I would come back to try additional rolls
