Lyw76j7yOIXudJLEqA17Cw.text: I'm giving this place two stars for the simple reason that the service was very good.  The food was terrible.   I will never go back. We got an appetizer that was OK but it needed some sort of dipping sauce. Then we got three rolls and for the first time in my life I had warm sushi. I could barely eat it. I tried to just go with it and the restaurant was hot, the food was warm; it's not a good sign.  Usually sushi restaurants are very, very cold because they're keeping the raw fish cold.  Anyway that was yesterday and last night and today I have been sick.  I'm regretting it so much.  I can't believe it has a 4/5 review average.

G5GKK1tUNf7Jb1SA8Kk58w.text: Always satisfied when we go. Excellent rolls, fresh sashimi and nigiri. Full bar with a good selection of sake. The staff is very friendly. The service is outstanding. They have several lunch specials that are all delicious.

4iTUo9wEXgIcs9FepgcyQA.text: Great place for drinks and sushi. Great happy hour options too. Service has always been top notch and I have never had a complaint about the food. I recommend Sakebombers to anyone looking for sushi in the Tempe area.

Cm6NSqhX435kmsIO4hH-pQ.text: Went in here because it was the closest place to me at then time and only one open somewhat late (it's currently 9:40) and I ordered yellowtail and salmon nigiri. I'm pretty disappointed. The fish tastes bland, feels mushy, and the rice tasted kind of sour... it was overpriced for this kind of quality. Service was pretty good, the yakisoba and caterpillar roll my boyfriend ordered was delicious- however lacking in the amount of eel that was put in it. The only complaint I have is pretty much the nigiri which is why I gave only 3 stars but overall experience 4.

L0EjWpxGVR1sOcm7QXOVNA.text: It hurts my heart....that's how good this place is.  What sets them apart are approximately 14 rolls unlike any I have had prior or since visiting there.  From spank me to evil, they all rocked my face off pretty good. Reasonable prices and they don't skimp on the ingredients.  I've never had a problem with the service so I guess there all good on my book.  I can't recommend any particular thing.  It got to the point going here where I would just point my finger at the menu without looking and order that.  This place is THAT good.

b_lnJhxBj8PrIvJ6VPnxlw.text: BEST RESTAURANT FOR ALL THINGS SUSHI AND NON-SUSHI!   My husband and I eat here frequently.  He loves sushi and raves about the sushi here, especially the specials (which aren't always on the menu).  Yesterday he had the Hawaiian Albacore special and loved it.   I had the salmon teriyaki bento box.  The salmon is sushi-grade and the best salmon teriyaki I have ever had.  The texture was incredible.  And for the real surprise, Sakebombers has the best creme brulee ever!  It's a must to finish a great meal.

Cb--W76dd2p_C1HtYEm-Pg.text: The food here at best is mediocre. We went there for happy hour and were shocked at our final bill, it was a rip off! They really skimp you on the appetizers and the quality of the food stinks. I can honestly say my favorite part if the Meal was the Kirin beer I had and the edamame beans. That should sum up my opinion of the food. Upon entering the restaurant the staff asks you for an ID to drink alcohol and give you a bracelet. It feels more like a college bar than a restaurant. It's a shame. This place does not hold a candle to "RA"

-Bsf7tTZTAzrbJeX3santQ.text: The food and drinks were amazing and their prices are very reasonable! The ambiance was very soothing and comfortable, staff was very friendly and we are definitely will be returning!!!!

4oBGmtk8XV5DP5uV-WNopA.text: This is my favorite sushi place! From the outside you might thing, 'weird spot for a sushi joint', to be honest i was always curious about what was inside the round-windowed building. I'm very glad I did! I love their wide variety of rolls (love, love love the specialty rolls! - the White Castle, Angry Shrimp, playgirl just to name a few) not to mention a full menu from the kitchen if you aren't a fan of raw fish;) they have a decent happy hour and reverse happy hour as well.

EewjBu0tSePecVxvOlgSnA.text: Wow....my friends and I went here last night after checking out the Yelp reviews. We normally go to Sushi Brokers or Kabuki, but their regular happy hours had ended for the night. We decided to give Sake Bombers a try since it's right down the street and their happy hour goes until 7 pm. We were extremely disappointed. The only roll we ended up finishing was the Boston roll, which was pretty good. The Crispy California and Tootsie were okay, but nothing great. The eel sauce was a little thick. The Salmon Dynamite roll is also just okay, but the spicy mayo here is HORRIBLE! My friend got a side of it and it seriously looked like someone just squeezed some Miracle Whip out of a tube and added some other flavors/colors to it. It was thick and chunky, and quite frankly disgusting. Do not order the Playgirl -- the fish on top was not fresh, and the ginger soy sauce was overwhelming. We barely touched this roll.   The happy hour was also not very great -- they didn't even have something simple like a spicy tuna on happy hour. Who wants to pay $7.50 for a basic roll that's normally on happy hour for around $4 at other places? I had a stomach ache for about two hours after eating here...I'm thankful I didn't get sick, but this was honestly the worst sushi experience I've ever had.   It's also kind of ironic that the food at this place was so poor, when the sushi chefs and most of the workers were actually Asian. We will not be returning here ever again.

YYLi_dtBryij73k5iX8bJw.text: Food was great and the service was awesome as well. Sapporo was cold and good!  I will be back!

y5yEA8-bwY9rSLLzyPDvDA.text: Great sushi!! Service is just okay. The happy hour is great and super affordable. The sashimi has always been fresh. We live around the corner from this place so we frequently go here. Definitely would recommend it!

Di2bHBBOH-eex5BNdelLPg.text: Service was very slow, took an hour for two sushi rolls on a night with only a few tables full. Edamames were under-steamed, sashimi wasn't served on ice and was not cold - not a safe sign. Would not return.

eL0B4tRwCF63-AA7SExfNA.text: Yummy sushi and good service.  Now the building is a whole different story. It reminds you of something along the line of an old record store, bar or strip club., .  It was very clean and again excellent sushi!! If I'm ever back in town I will return!!!

rTBKlPQvqVrJV0OgqRbFog.text: Sake Bomber has very good sushi and excellent sashimi.  Maybe one time in five the sushi doesn't quite hit the mark for whatever reason, but even then it is good.  The sashimi is invariably spot-on.  The lead BT (Owen) is excellent and knowledgable on the food as well.  Definitely does me justice on my beloved Absolut Kamikaze's.  You have absolutely got to try their fresh wasabi, it is the best ever and destroys the paste.  Prices are low to average, every once in a while I find myself a little bit surprised at the tab, but it is certainly within reason.  Actually, the suprises are generally due to loading up on the booze, so I'm to blame for that aspect.  They have some fairly decent happy hour specials, and that helps to cut the bill.  I will say the exterior is basic, but the interior is fairly nice and authentic enough.  It can get a tad noisy, especially on Friday nights since this is just under 2 miles from ASU.  I don't mind this in that our kids go to ASU and to me the younger crowd's vitality is appealing.  Granted, if you are looking for a quiet dining experience you might want to avoid the weekend nights.  Weekday nights are usually fairly quiet.  In total, Sake Bomber is my absolute favorite for sushi and sashimi in the Phoenix area, and most certainly it's the best in Tempe.  About the only downside is that it's a bit noisy on the weekends, but that is not enough to slide the "5" rating down to a "4".  I guess I would add that maybe one time in five the service is slow since it can get packed quite quickly.  However, the foodservers and BTs are pleasant and knowledgable about their offerings.   Whatever you do, you've just got to try their fresh wasabi.  It's boatloads better than the paste.   Pretty sure it's a $1, but that will be the best dollar you will spend for the year.  If you're the drinking type, ask for an Absolut kamikaze, goes great with the sashimi.

RMfQz2iXIF3ca9rJwxNT3g.text: I was here May 14th with a friend. The service was amazing and the server was very nice. We sat at the sushi bar in front of the head chef and another chef. When i ordered my food, the head chef went out of his way to hand me different sauces that would go very well with the dish i ordered. It tasted amazing!! The head chef really knows what he's doing! I recommend this place to everyone!!!

xsA5tXI8rYYhwMVcTWQZRg.text: I live nearby and this is a good quick go to place for sushi. It's not the best i've had but it's very good and reasonably priced. Decor is more modern with 90's to current music playing. If you're in the neighborhood stop by for some good sushi and a sake bomb!

Ko8vdrtglABsSweDkaWeog.text: I have been coming to Sake Bombers for years now and everytime I go it's an amazing experience. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The sushi is affordable and delicious! Hands down my favorite place in Arizona to have sushi!

E5V4rUXWpHdAYyZfm2dCaQ.text: I had the worst sushi roll (salmon skin roll) in my life here! It was burnt.... other rolls and sashimi are medocre at best. Mido and kabuki are way better than this place.

E9PxSlefn6HqfxYB4QfXUw.text: S has been on Yelp searching cool places for me to try during my visit here to the Phoenix area.  Being away from home and wanting some comfort food, S suggested that I try Sake Bomber to get my sushi fix. The location was in close proximity to my hotel so I made arrangements for transportation to the restaurant. The staff at the front desk mentioned that the food there was pretty good.  So, let's put that into perspective...  I'm sure that there are many fine restaurants in the Phoenix area. When I'm visiting I love to experience restaurants (not chain) to get a taste of the local flavor. I'll have to say that SakeBomber is not the best representative of what Japanese food should be...  I arrived during happy hour and the wait staff was very friendly and accommodating. I had imagined that I might be able to catch up on some reading while dining - but this was not the case. A patron of the restaurant, who thought he was being funny, was loud and demanding more drinks from the server. The dark interior, dim lighting and thumping music wasn't conducive to a serene dining experience.   Oh well, I was here to get my sushi fix. I'm thinking that I shouldn't judge on appearances and maybe, just maybe, the sushi would redeem the thoughts that were going through my head.  First came the gyoza and agedashi tofu. The gyoza was ok, but was very disappointed with the agedashi. I'm used to the agedashi dishes from Gombei or Hoshi's - piping hot chunks of creamy deep friend tofu, swimming in that wonderful sauce, covered with bonito flakes, grated ginger and radish. Instead I got chunks of barely warm firm tofu arranged on a platter with tempura sauce and sprinkled with a few green onions. I was hungry so, I ate it.   I must admit that the salmon skin roll was the best deal of it all - 8 pieces of salmon skin nigiri with grilled asparagus and carrots. It was filling as well as yummy. I also had smoke salmon and hamachi maki. The fish was not the best I ever had, but I think that the sake I had during dinner helped the experience along with watching the snow boarding competition on the big screen TV behind the bar.   I called the hotel shuttle to pick me up after dinner. I had to chuckle when the driver asked, "How in the world did you end up at SakeBombers?"  "You see," I told him. "It was like this..."

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

nu9dgCmikjPDmTdKlNb9lA.text: This place has a cool atmosphere.The lunch specials are a pretty good deal. They do I.D. right from the get go, which working in food service I get. Once or twice I had to wait a little longer then I expected to for the food, but the just gave me time to enjoy my drinks. HH is always a good deal and they just extended it from 5pm to close! Cant go wrong with that

7kak8iYLTDqDrcGemoJ4Dg.text: I went here last Saturday night with my boyfriend and to meet up with friends for dinner. I was pleasantly surprised by everything! From the street, this place doesn't look like much, but inside, it has a pretty cool, low lit ambience. You are carded from the moment you get to the hostess stand. It's Tempe! Don't take it personal. IF you are of the sipping age, you get a bracelet from that point so that you can partake in what else? Sake Bombing! We had several apps upon ordering. Crab puffs, ( I can't have them due to a food allergy), but they smelled awesome and were gone within 8 minutes. The cucumber salad is always a fav of mine when I am at a sushi place, and this one came with a couple of crab sticks atop. So good. For our sushi rolls, we ordered the special, Miso Sexy roll; the Firecracker Roll; The White Castle roll, (I know you expect the thing to be topped with midwestern burgers!), which was hands down, everyones favorite.. (and no... no burgers!); The usual Vegas roll; we had nigiri in salmon and tuna. Complete with sake bombers and the special of $3 raspberry vodka that you can do anyway; we did seltzer. All that for 4 people, under a $100. We walked away very full and decided that this is now our new favorite sushi place. Sometimes you just never know how surprised you may be by what isn't 'pretty' on the outside, yet amazing on the inside!

0zSPjN9pzKsUTQa1h7QuoQ.text: I've been here twice now and really enjoyed it! I have tried a couple different rolls and appetizers and have liked all of them. The service is about average, nothing outstanding, but nothing bad. I LOVE the happy hour/reverse happy hour specials! They have many drinks, appetizers, and rolls at a discount.

vvrNtUc_0IpFgbg-UyOmuA.text: okay, so we went here on a recommendation from a friend (in addition to the high Yelp rating). First off, none of the food was actually bad but it just wasn't good. a 4-star rating is way too high for this place. the happy hour was moderately priced but full of mayonnaisey California roll derivatives. It could have been worse, but we would just as soon go anywhere else.

rhCytvX-mKXy3qMaoHbteQ.text: this place is pretty good. i went there with my friends after the ASU games and i have to say the restaurant is really nice. the food is good, the people are nice.   i would recommend sake bomber sushi to anyone looking for a fun night out. the drink specials are nice for those of you who are 21+  overall, a great restaurant.

a4i0v4c97b9qdVbyb_eIgg.text: Love love LOVE this place!  Rolls are reasonably priced, especially during happy hour and the serving are very large.  The crowd has more of a "college" feel to as it's located near ASU, but you will find the occasional Grandma in there digging on some edamame.  My favorite roll is the Playgirl roll, and the Salmon Dynamite roll...delish!

Cavpkf53hYjOF11QmV3K_A.text: So I started a yelp account for the sole reason to warn people looking for sushi. It's 12:18 In the after noon, I ate there at 9pm. I was woken at 2am, 4am, and all day today been disturbed by the most foul stomach problems I've ever encountered, as with my gf. This place by far has the WORST quality sushi I've ever endured, I don't care how cheap their drinks are, this place blows. **warning** only eat at the place if you need a legitmate reason to get a doctors note to dip o class the next day**

L5eAWVy8M7F3_SdNwwaPUA.text: I went to Sakebomber for the first time a few days ago with some friends! Every roll we ordered was delicious! I even ordered the specialty roll, which ended up being my favorite! (their sauces are yummy too!) The lady at the front was super sweet and our server was upbeat and chill, so was the vibe. I definitely will be back!

gU0SiiSkJwLbod7fYUEYCg.text: Visited a friend in Tempe last weekend and we were craving sushi and this is were we ended up. We had an early dinner on a Monday night and it was not busy at all. The staff was friendly, the ambiance was cool, the hot sake was great and the good is what you expect of Americanized sushi. Over all good experience and would definitely come back if I lived closer.  In noticed a lot of people on Yelp complain about the IDing at the door and the wristband, but it really didn't  bother me at all. This location probably gets a lot of college kids coming in, and this way the waiters can easily see who can order another round in big groups without having to remember who they carded or not. If you are over 21 stop your complaining and just drink, if your not 21 and complaining then just shut up, sit down, and don't embarrass yourself.

z1NrSxr2vlNHlxsysHmBdA.text: Pretty good sushi and noodle dishes.  They have some unique rolls and the service is great!  Having a good looking waitress helps ;-) We had the spicy tuna and playboy rolls plus some yellow tail.  The boba is also very good.

NPto7awUrbPEJE83ILCDeg.text: This place is delicious. Was in Tempe and decided to try it. Super delicious. Everything was high quality and made well. Only con was the alcohol was a little expensive. If I skipped the alcohol it would have been much cheaper but not as fun. Next time I'm in Tempe I will be back!

_sy3otmS82fWjoFd0SQcJQ.text: As with every place, it starts off with five stars.  However, as soon as we walk into the door we get carded. And if we're over 21 they put bracelets on us. I think that is the stupidest thing. I mean I saw other reviewers complain about this and thought that they would get rid of that stupid policy but no. It's just as dumb as everyone talks about.   Subtract 2 stars  The atmosphere: I liked it to be honest. It was casual and relaxed and the place was clean. Even if I wasn't on a date I would come back with my friends for a few drinks and some crap talking.  Add a star.  The food: was average. Nothing too special. I hated that they make you pay more for eel sauce whereas Ra, the most expensive sushi place ever, doesn't even make you pay more for eel sauce.  Minus a star.  The service was okay, not anything to brag about, but not anything to complain about.  Neither add nor lose a star.  Now the most important detail about any place to me is the drinks. And I loved their drinks! I had a black raspberry lemondrop martini or something and it was delicious. I had their cold sake sampler - also delicious and tried my dates drinks as well.   This place knows their alcohol.  Add a star.  I'll be coming back, if only for the drinks.

FxA33jx7miQ9yd2CPE_4mQ.text: Ever since my hubby and I moved to Tempe from the northwest valley, we've been looking for a place to feed our sushi craving.  Unfortunately, SakeBomber will not be our new go-to.  We sat at the sushi bar and our order was taken.  After we got our beers, we didn't see the server until after we had finished all of our rolls.  The sushi chef just handed us our rolls so the server never had to come over to give us what we had ordered.  I was looking for the server so we could order more drinks and she was nowhere to be found.  I couldn't even flag down any other servers because they all whizzed by so fast that I couldn't get their attention. It was a little weird that they had to give us a wristband so we could drink.  I felt like I was at a waterpark or something. My husband and I were not impressed with the freshness of the sushi or the flavor of the specialty rolls.  The spicy tuna had virtually no flavor and no spice.

6wsVqWNruvR3zc0oFbKJQQ.text: As I'm not much a fan of sushi, I got the teriyaki chicken dinner and was very pleased! You get so much food: miso soup before your meal arrives, salad, gyoza, rice, and mushrooms with your chicken. It was all very tasty and I definitely recommend it if you're not a sushi fan.   Afterwards I got the mochi ice cream, which you get two choices of flavors; I ended up getting the mango and strawberry. The plate was beautiful and the ice cream was delicious, the strawberry was my favorite. Definitely coming back!

_aGB08FN47xzZq8DTaaRaQ.text: A fun restaurant! Staff is friendly and service is good. I usually come for the nigiri and the Orange slice. Recently tried their yakisoba which was yummy and their fried rice which was okay. Being near the university, the crowd can be on the younger side but I've never felt out of place.

2WPD3nC1cadp3xxPycFmyw.text: People saying this is great sushi have not even had good sushi. Sorry, I'm a food snob. Actually, I shouldn't apologize for knowing what good Japanese food looks and tastes like.  SakeBomber is another addition to my "Asian food in Phoenix disappoints" list. Oh and I won't embellish on how annoying it is to wear a wristband upon entry if I'm even just contemplating ordering a drink through my meal.   PS: I'm not as bitter as I sound right now.

YRw03gtDEdJuAQQQBoJ0IQ.text: I don't know about the management here but the food is great.   My server Kelsey was awesome, she told me about a "secret" menu item, I don't know if it actually is but I told her what I like and she recommended the sesame sea bass and it was amazing. I'm pretty sure the chef(s) we're Mark and Steve? I was so happy with my food and how it was prepared. The sashimi was out with daikon radish which is meant for garnish but it was so good. I asked Kelsey about it and the chefs were kind enough to give me a giant pile of it.   Everyone was so attentive and helpful, I have been there since and I don't think Kelsey works there any more, unfortunate for the company because her service would keep me coming back - however I have seen the same chefs and the food has remained wonderful. Good prices, good food and I personally had great service.   Good sashimi and you've got me. I've been elsewhere since but Sake Bombers is great for the prices you get - if Kelsey comes back, call me, but in the meantime hang onto Mark and Steve as long as you can.

6y-xuTtjxZFxEVT12L_kTQ.text: This place is yummy but a little pricey for the quality. The service is always alright but nothing special. When we do go it tends to be with a large group of friends (5-8) they always are able to accommodate quickly which is really nice!

g19eBzG_VWuuoguvpQmckA.text: Good food- BAD service.   Food: AGADASHI TOFU!!! SO good! sushi is good, love their salmon skin rolls- chicken teriyaki is really really good.  The reason I give only 2 stars is because the service is TERRIBLE.    Went there with a party of four, place was empty.  They didn't clear our appetizer plates off our tiny table when bringing the rolls out so the plates were hanging off the tables.   We had to ask 2 different people 3 times for the green (sodium free) soy sauce after they brought the sushi (took about 15 minutes to get the soy sauce so we had to sit there staring at it for 15 minutes instead of eating it While one person in our party waited for soy sauce).  When we needed refills, waitress was nowhere to be found.    Also, they  Gave us the check before we asked for it which is strange for a sushi restaurant and we definitely would've ordered more if our waitress hadn't decided for us that our meal was over.   Three different people came to our table AFTER we payed the check (where were they during the meal??). as if they wanted us to leave even though the place was empty and it was nowhere near closing time.  Really Weird vibe from staff at the end of the meal.  The other two times I ate there the service was Okay.  I probably wouldn't dine in again, but I might consider ordering the  tofu for pick up!

lnmkddMPWuZpy9ASc6lCVA.text: Everything was amazing! Delicious sake, delicious tuna, and service was perfect! Would recommend this place to any sushi lover!

c7LdtCHPZgmwT6eqQ0HLbA.text: As soon as we walked in the door, we were carded by the hostess and given wristbands to wear so our waitress would know we were legal drinking age. I have to say that was a first for me at a restaurant. Bizarre, but ok, I get it...Tempe is a college town. They must have been busted previously.   Our server was very attentive and friendly. We liked her a lot. It was "interesting" to see 3 college aged guys behind the sushi counter rolling maki rolls. They probably went to ASU. This is who was making our sushi.   The garlic shrimp appetizer was amaze balls actually. I mean, really really good! The sushi however was below mediocre. Not much flavor and tasted like something I could purchase at a grocery store. A for effort, but not good. At. All.  Definitely will not go back, but once again the service was great. The sushi, not so much.

BVMESEv5HLo-v3SiHzo1sA.text: PRO: Having a sushi bar across the street is great, and the drinks here are relatively cheap (especially during reverse happy hour)  CON: Carding me at the door while I'm on a date and making us wear wristbands is about as tacky as it gets. And the sushi is nothing to write home about.

Ba4fLhliVF_w40Qfar3bmA.text: Been here for work a while back horrible rude management .. Love sushi , will never spend a dollar of my money here just bc how they treated me...don't care what their food taste like when you have no respect !

wj_YjPaLVlahp0GahABJsg.text: Best toostie roll in the valley, Revere's happy hour rules... Love this place... $5 cocktails, $2 sake, the eel roll is great and so is the scallop dynamite roll...

_pb9MpxXaR4OIC0pk_2oew.text: My absolute favorite sushi place in Tempe! Always have a spot available and can always look forWard to great prices and fresh, delicious sushi. They also have milk tea available that is always a good side note with the sushi! I will definitely be back. Plus they have the BEST happy hour around! Definitely worth a try!

9LI7MTPVPlzOrQb5t1HTaw.text: Restaurant was dark and service was slow; there were only a few people in the restaurant just after lunch. The rolls were mediocre at best; nothing special. I will not be going back.

-tAfRrTntuoMK4S0hV3MMg.text: So the tuna was off..  gross texture and was just off. Told server... she says yeah, the other lady said the same thing about the tuna so its just not you. Also asked why the fresh wasabi was slimy... was told it was prob from the bottom of the bag which makes it slimy and next time i should ask for the top of the bag...  wont be a next time, but thanks anyway!

JuI3yjv9ZRfoqtDosVT7IA.text: We came to this establishment for their happy hour. It was from 5 to 9 PM... and then they have reverse happy hour from 9 to close... but only until August 22nd.  My lady and I each had beers: she had Kirin light, I had Kirin as well as sake. The taste was the usual to be expected from any other establishments. I have remarked though that I am always satisfied by the taste of Japanese beers: I would say easy to drink yet with a bit more flavor than our run of the mill American beers (Bud, Miller, Coors).  We enjoyed edemame, mussels and clams, as well as beef pot stickers. The edemame could have been a bit more salty, otherwise tasted fresh and flavorfull. The seafood was excellent and the sauce that it was prepared with added an extra level of tasty sweet and salty/spicy flavor to which I would say this appetizer is a must try. The pot stickers were cooked well: they did not seem like they were made of paper, amd had a bit of crispiness to them.  For our entree we enjoyed the white castle roll, a rainbow roll, and a playgirl rool. Also had salmon sashimi. All of the sushi tasted fresh and had a good and clean presentation. The sashimi was given to use with an extra green sauce that was high on the spicy scale, yet went away quite fast: it was not unpleasant. The salmon, again, was fresh tasting. The white castle roll is a definite recommendation: it is good! A bit of crunchy along with some good flavor. The playgirl roll was chosen for my lady as it has avocado on top as well as albacore. It was very good. Rainbow roll was also good: a generic roll with many sashimi flavors on top.  The dining room was clean with plenty of space without feeling cranoed. Our waitress was attentive.

xGgFrX8AMnrbzLyo84qs4w.text: Sakebomber is my go-to place for sushi. Mostly because it's right down the street, but I'm OBSESSED with their tootsie roll and their happy hour prices are pretty reasonable! (Happy hour is all day now on certain days, I think, or is otherwise really lengthy and then paired with reverse happy hour immediately afterward)! They have great deals and innovative rolls. Admittedly it's very Americanized but that doesn't make it any less delicious. The quality has never been lacking in the food in the times that I've went, and they are very generous with their portions. Thick-cut rolls, and lots of pieces in them, not like some rinky-dink four-piece rolls that go for full-price. There are always 8, 10, 12 pieces per roll!  Their eel sauce is also unique. They have some honey in it which is unusual but super yummy. :') The servers are also always attentive and engaging, so no complaints there! Atmosphere is also really nice!

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. TOOTSIEEEEEE
Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. MORE TOOTSIE
Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

2zZpVih7PCPtgUFOeHJfXg.text: Sushi was fairly decent. But I felt it was overpriced for the quality and that was even with happy hour pricing.

kRfomucgZZ1EV6pmZyudMg.text: This place used to be good, it really did. The food still has the same mid-level sushi snap that you'd expect to find at other places like it (RA, for one) but the management has really let it slide over the past four years.  The servers here are just terrible. Rule #1 of serving, if a customer asks where their food is you apologize. Apologize apologize. Don't berate them, or tell them that it's coming up soon. Treat them like human beings. Usually you see a couple career servers in the place but more often than not you'll find the college-aged bottle blonde screwing up orders and talking to her friends about how expensive rent is in Tempe.  Also, NEVER go to this place between 7pm-9pm, as those are the only two hours that aren't "happy" and you'll find yourself being charged top shelf prices for some pureed tuna and loads of mayonnaise (an American sushi tradition I still don't understand).  That brings me to my last gripe. The place used to have 24hr happy hour. It was great, and you didn't go into the dark restaurant worried about paying too for bad sushi. Now, you might get hosed on the regular prices and have to sit in this sticky, dark doldrum while waiting 30 minutes for your food.

dVw4TIgcjRVVzBYZsSGfkA.text: Stopped by for lunch because I have been craving some good sushi. I was not disappointed. The fish is super fresh. The wasabi is excellent and the miso soup is very nice. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I would definitely go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lunch special sashimi
Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Miso soup
Photo of SakeBomber Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bar area.

_9FoQN4AsGRYgg9iY7v8RA.text: I love this place :) I'm a dancer and I always get out of the studio like 9 or 10 pm, and there is no better place than SakeBomber for a pair of hungry dancers lol  Their Seafood fried rice and their Unagi nigiri are my favorite and my friends love their Evil Roll.  Go try it yourself :) strongly recommend

p79xdFf37RtGAKja1QBAEQ.text: I would first like to address the wristbands ordeal, as it seems to be a primary concern for the adults. It is displayed at the front counter and often times has to be explained to rude customers in front of us why they do that: they are required to by law. I'd say it's a small price to pay to drink and keep underage kids from recklessness. Not to mention shutting the place down.  As far as the food goes, I don't get sushi anywhere else. Sakebomber is the only place I go! And for good reason! Places like Ra don't even light a candle!! It's authentic with a mix of American persuasion and has great original rolls you won't find anywhere else. The prices really range on what you like. It is a well rounded menu.  As far as service, I've never had any complaints. It does get super busy on Friday nights so I recommend making a reservation to a avoid having to wait. The servers have always been very sweet and like to strike up friendly conversations when the moment warrants it. The managers like to roam and make a point to introduce themselves and are very eager to help if you have any questions.  Bathrooms are small but clean. I always recommend Sakebombers to friends and visiting family.

-CvJMW8Hc3a8iRazTSLtyg.text: Dark and laid-back environment. I ordered the beef teriyaki. It wasn't impressive, though I can't cook any better at home but it definitely looked and tasted like something you could make with $10 and a Fry's card. This seems like a cool weekend place to go for a chill hangout away from Mill Ave.'s scene. I don't remember exactly what time they advertised when they closed, but they definitely started cleaning up and kicking people out about 30-40 mins before. Not on my list of go-to's in the future.

jto-8tzcBtK4ZtMs6IH7zQ.text: Came here on a whim for date night and my boyfriend and I were both super happy! We got gyoza, two rolls of sushi and tea. Everything was delicious, particularly the pork gyoza, and we didn't have to wait forever. There were a few other tables filled but it wasn't packed and the atmosphere was nice. Our wait staff was wonderful and friendly. It's a bit tucked away, so you don't see it immediately, but absolutely worth the discovery!

HphQ4c7GBfpHJKRMa2jVIA.text: I go here all the time and it's pretty good... MOST of the time. Other times it is just awful but I will hit the positive first.   The food is very good. I especially like the Cherry Blossom roll (Although it is not on the sushi checklist and I have to write it in every time). Typically a great fresh taste, the wait staff and sushi chefs are mostly pretty friendly. When I order to go It usually doesn't take long. All of the times I've ordered the special it was amazing.   But there are some negatives that make me never want to go back.  1) Menu: Sushi menu is not in alphabetical order, descriptions are not posted online and the checklist does not even list all of the rolls on the menu. I've inquired about this and they are "redoing" the menu.  That was over 6 months ago.  Get it together.   2) Now I really don't care that the make you get a wristband at the door but they explain it with a written statement taped to the front desk stating how they were recently busted for a liquor violation. I happened to be doing some research the other day and was on the AZ Department of Liquor's website and did a quick search of all the liquor violations in Tempe for the last 3 years. I didn't see SakeBomber on there. I guess it's not that big of a deal but really, why make up a story?   3) Some of the team members are just plain rude. For instance, the other day I ordered a to-go order. I ordered a Cherry Blossom roll, a tootsie make, an Alaska roll and a shrimp tempura. I should've been suspicious as I repeated "cherry blossom roll" twice and the woman kept repeating back simply "blossom roll". When I go to pick up my order It is a Boston roll... I'm thinking, no big deal, it was simply a misunderstanding but there is more. The woman at the front makes it into a production going over to another employee to discuss what is going on. After a few minutes the woman comes back and tells me "I don't know if it was your fault or her fault but we will go ahead and replace this, we are busy so it might take a while." I think blaming your customers is probably not the best business practice. I believe these two ladies were the owners from the people I've talked to about it.      On top of that we got a teeny tiny (1 oz cup) side of eel sauce with our tootsie maki so we asked for more. They said it would be 75 cents.  I had already paid so I got 3 quarters out of my wallet and handed it to the lady. At first she forgets it so I bring it up when I double check my order (after we waited to have the order corrected). Then the lady rings it in and makes me pay the few extra cents of tax. Are you kidding me? I left you an 18% tip on a to-go order in acknowledgement of the work you do to put it together. That being said, I expect it to be done right. The order was wrong to begin with, I waited over 30 minutes, you included less eel sauce than if I had been dining in, we willingly pay for more, you forget it and then bring up that I am short 3 cents. Needless to say I was quite irked.  4) No bike rack. It's Tempe. A lot of people ride bikes and as a community, this should be something we encourage. It's good exercise and environmentally friendly. There are programs in Tempe that will help cover the cost of installing a bike rack but judging by their previous behavior and their unwillingness to let 3 cents slide I'm guessing they are WAY to cheap to ever install one.      TL;DR : This place is great. On occasion I will have an absolute horrible experience that would typically cause me to never go back but most of the time it is so great so I forgive them. ... Also, it's right down the street :-)

AjYyDcNprK9PS1g-UwuvsQ.text: A co-worker and I decided to try this place for a quick bite to eat.  We fell in love.  There are fun and interesting specialty rolls especially the ones with a little kick to them.  We've been back a few times.  The service has always been excellent, food quality better than average, and we've recommended it to other people in our office.

aezcKg6h3wy79PBnvI7vjA.text: Nice to finally find a sushi place with mixed cocktails along with the traditional sakes as well, but that is probably the only highlight I have of dinner.  Since this place is near the ASU campus, it definitely has a younger of drinking age clientele, who have yet to be exposed to outstanding, and fresh sushi.  This place definitely has mediocre sushi, and it is safe to say I won't be back again.

umUpRcl7lju7i2zrFgWqyg.text: My pals always give me a hard time for liking this place as much as I do, but honestly, the food is never a disappointment to me; I always get just what I am expecting. Their Lollipop roll is my favorite roll on the planet. It's a mix of fish, crab, with cream cheese & masago, and their spicy ponzu sauce for dipping, wrapped in cucumber. Best. Ever. If they ever discontinued it, I would probably stop going! Ha. It's that good. I also am almost always greeted politely by the GM, Rebecca. She's a sweetheart! She usually forgets and calls me Christine, but it's endearing, so I let it slide ;-)  I love this place! It's usually youngsters that are serving, but they're on top of things, and helpful. Prices are really great during HH, too!  You must try the Lychee martini as well. Not a strong drink, but super delish.

bITIuvPOgdva8rVJkCuYng.text: Great sushi selection.   Good HH prices.   They had 4 beers on draught when I was in last night including a couple Four Peaks options.   Servers and hostesses were great!  Will be back :)

71iBWV6BEw8z0w6FmIxl3Q.text: I was really hoping that this Japanese restaurant would be better than expected, however I left not feeling that impressed. I came by on a Saturday night with two of my friends at around 9 PM and while we didn't mind waiting for a table, the person at the desk seemed a bit rushed and were asking us if we planned on having any drinks before sitting down at the table. The atmosphere was definitely on the trendy side as I saw a lot of younger folks. At times it felt difficult to make conversation just due to the noise levels.  My friends ordered sushi as well as an udon noodle soup. We thought that the sushi was about average and the udon noodle soup my friend liked. As for my order I got the chicken teriyaki dinner box which was average as well. It did take us a while to get our food and it was quite pricey for what we got. I really hope there are better spots in the Valley to get Japanese food...

C45V5VFAZ8w8RhregiCGgw.text: This place is  3-star ok.   The tofu and tempura dishes were very tasty.   The vegi sushi and cucumber sushi were a bit on the bland and dry side.  Also I know cream cheese was optional.  I recommend you skip it.  It throws the taste all off.    Service was ok too.  Someone is coaching/directing the staff on what they need to do.   Perhaps there is a checklist in the back reminding them.  However the execution was distracting.   To the staff, here are a few tips:  DON'T put the dirty dishes from the next table on my table while you fill up my water glass.    DON'T take my empty plate away a mere .5 seconds after I grabbed the food from it.  Give me time to put the food in my mouth, chew, swallow, and savor the experience of eating it for another minute before you take my plate away.   Overall I would consider coming back, but for the moderate prices, there's a lot more places to choose from.

BOmCdrm-xXptBkWlF0j8SA.text: I've been here 3 times in about the span of a year so I feel fairly familiar with the consistency of this place.  First off, HAPPY HOUR! And then REVERSE HAPPY HOUR! ...Ok, I'm calm. I've only ever been here for a happy hour, so I'm unsure if they always card at the door. They get pretty slammed at times so I totally understand making it easy by putting a wristband on the 21+. This is perfectly acceptable. The host is usually pointing out the special by the door while checking ID's. People need to stop complaining.   The staff is friendly and decently attentive. It's a good place for a date or a group. The food is good. Everything's always been fresh. Their Tootsie, Las Vegas (I always get it without jalapeno), and Dragon rolls are good. Sometimes the Rainbow can be a little dry. I've noticed that the Playgirl can get a little skimpy. I think it comes with avocado and sometimes it hasn't had very much. I think that was the problem. I wish they'd put descriptions of their rolls online. I don't normally do spicy but the Lollipop was good. It's just spicy enough to not be overpowering. Any time I've had the eel nigiri it's been a good texture. Perfectly falls apart in your mouth without being mushy.

0upZA7suReU1painPK1YdA.text: The 5 stars is based on their sashimi. The fish practically melts in your mouth. It's so fresh with none of the icky oily feel from most of the other places I've been to. The best thing is their fresh wasabi, which tastes so much better than the usual green glob served. The downside is of course that sashimi is quite expensive.  Their sushi rolls, while creative and decently sized, weren't all that unique. Keep in mind practically all sushi rolls taste similar to me so I won't let that affect my rating.

eCOPDM3yf1duwQTO3uMwMw.text: This place is the TITS! All day happy hour during the summer and some bad ass drinks!

INgjrj1xQ5frj84reJdBRw.text: Really disappointed...so pricey for what you get, small rolls with no flavor.  The instead of pretty much a dump, never again.

EUidwrw5DPJY6dM_N02fUQ.text: I have to say that when I first came in the door and saw a couple of white guys behind the sushi bar... I said to myself, "uh, oh!" I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of sushi. I ordered the rainbow roll and juicy roll. Unfortunately, my waitress didn't hear me right and she got me the tootsie roll instead of the juicy roll. Still, not too bad. There's loud music, so I can understand. The quality of the food more than made up for the mistake. If I lived in the area, I wouldn't hesitate to come back here again. Prices are great for the rolls.

dwbUTobhqNam8Ba7KQUAkg.text: This place was a pleasant surprise!  We are vegetarian and found a lot of choices on the menu. The veggie spring rolls are awesome, vegetable tempura also very good. Everything we ate was exceptional, including the veggie roll sushi. I was also impressed that their house sake, on happy hour, was actually good tasting. I was used to places using cheap tasting sake. Again, another pleasant surprise. We are happy to have found this place and will be back!

y-FBGHCB99YCyXH_uwNUuA.text: you absolutely have to try the lollipop roll - it's my all-time favorite. also give their lychee martini a shot. mmm mmm good.   dooooo iiiiiit.

tMuDRdqxawTzFKFrOcIbKg.text: My second time here was a lot of fun. It started out a bit rocky though, but was quickly turned around. We walked in and immediately noticed how uncomfortable warm and stale the restaurant was. We were seated promptly by the friendly hostess and given our menus (which were promptly snatched away by my friend who decided to order for all of us). Now the recent is decent sized, and there were only 3 other tables occupied, but it took between 10 and 15 minutes before we were acknowledged by our server and another 5 before she took our drink orders. Or drinks were quickly brought to us and or appetizers then sushi came quickly after. The server was friendly and adjusted the air for us which made remarkable improvement on our comfort level. For appetizers we had the edamame, which was good, Can't really screw that up though (although I prefer mine cold). We also had the tempura sampler with onion, shrimp, potato, and sweet potato. All were tasty and perfectly cooked. The potato was my favorite. For sushi, we had the dragon roll, evil roll, and the play boy. All were wonderful, but the evil roll was by far my favorite and I loved the sauce it came drowned in. Could have had a bit more heat to it but it was soooo good!

NXwJ6HGO1qz8oHw014lCng.text: i loveee sushi~ i was excited that this was the place my family was taking me to when i returned home from a semester abroad! the food was delicious and the service was great, super satisfied :) don't believe me? visit and you'll know~ nom nom nom

pBYR6jSFchcn7HpOKLG8iA.text: This place is amazing.  We eat there once a week and, more often than not, are accompanied by family and friends.  The food is incredible, very fresh, creative, and tasty.  Whatever the special is, order it.  It's always good, and I have found myself requesting a former item that was on special, even though it is not on the menu.  That's the other wonderful thing about SakeBombers: the service.  The staff is wonderful.  They have never steered me wrong with a recommendation and do not hesitate to accommodate any special requests that we have made.   Yoshi, server/bartender, is always very friendly and welcoming.  Their happy hour is amazing - $1.50 for delicious miso soup!  SakeBombers blows other sushi out of the water!

QO3tXdx9tHDDTorn6HTnew.text: Love their sushi! I prefer this place over "Ra" because it's never overcrowded. They have a decent happy hour, and their prices aren't bad either.

YAC28osZvDybedBt7EbMyQ.text: I love love love their happy hour and reverse happy hour specials!! Their bronze medal is great! Tuesdays have $2 beer specials great service good atmosphere if there were 6 stars I'd give them it!!

CYikWq2IUj0A7VD26eG-rg.text: This place redeemed itself the last time the boyfriend and I went. When he said, "You're not going to like what I say," when I asked what he wanted for dinner, I knew that he would suggest something I had previously complained about.  The time before this, I was appalled that I had to wear a wristband for my (relatively) expensive meal. I'm not going to a club or a concert so having my I.D. scrutinized in 484 different ways then told to wear a paper-plastic bracelet seems really silly.  I did hear it was because they were busted for underage drinking more than once so it's for legitimate reasons. Ok back to the present. We went through the whole wristband crap all over again, were seated by the courteous hostess. So far so good. We ordered Kirin and cheap sake for $7 a pop. Sushi comes out and everything is pretty tasty. Boyfriend got the "spank me" and "playboy" roll which he finally had to courage to order without embarassment.  After our meal, the hostess and what I assume to be a manager and owner brought out this strawberry sauce smore thingy for free and told us that she has seen us in there a lot and wanted us to keep coming back.  A FAR better experience than before--possibly because it wasn't sakebomber frat night and the hoes were'nt hadn't come out to play but I did rather enjoy myself.

6ONupsbIwP0LoaYV4HydcQ.text: I am a local and have been frequenting Sakebomber for a little over a year now, and I have to say it's my favorite sushi restaurant. I've tried several sushi places in the area and the best bang for your buck exists at Sakebomber.  I have tried a majority of their specialty rolls and although I have picked out which are my favorites, I am usually satisfied with trying something new. My absolute favorite is the lollipop roll, then the fiesta roll and spank me roll. The sashimi is very good. You have to ask the sushi chefs if they have any great fish, as the quality of each whole fish is different from the next, and they will let you know if one of the selections is exceptionally good that day. They cut fish fresh most days or every day, so the quality will vary between your visits.  As far as drink selection, it's definitely a girly mixed drink-focused drink menu. If you are looking for high quality alcoholic beverages, don't hold your breath. But if you're looking for a place to have a few drinks over dinner with friends, Sakebomber is a good choice.  Overall, this is usually the first choice for me for sushi, only second when I'm trying a new restaurant.

lL7K3GQiimlsN7fw4e1Ffg.text: WE tried Sake Bomber for the first time a few weeks ago and as far as AZ sushi places go, we thought this place was awesome.  The service was great, and the sushi was very tasty, generous servings and priced right.  We will definately be going back.

RrPEI_rHx1jDwXxq8FPUzg.text: I love this place. The Las Vegas roll is amazing however the crispy California roll isn't that crispy. Their sake is in fact bomb and the restaurant it always a good time. Their prices are reasonable for sushi places in Tempe and the service has always been awesome. If you've got a party bigger than 4 though, call ahead.

riEJEz0P89NKMkrfD1s5HA.text: Yipes!  A "1-Star"? How did that happen?  Let me first start off by saying this is NOT for the sushi enthusiast.  If you are looking for good sushi, this should be your absolute last resort.  I can say without boasting that I know good sushi when I taste it, as I have visited many sushi places across the country and worked at a sushi restaurant.  This restaurant is definitely geared more towards the "hip group of drinking kids".  And when they say that this place isn't kid-friendly, trust me, IT ISN'T.  My husband and I decided to eat here just on a whim and since we did not have a sitter for our two kids, we had to take them.  We arrived in the early evening, so needless to say, it wasn't too busy and we could be served quickly.  It should be noted also, that although both of my kids were quiet and well-behaved as could be, we were still looked at with disgust from the waitstaff.  My husband and I orderded some edamame and simple rolls while our kids had the teriyaki chicken on a stick. We had also ordered two bowls of rice.  The edamame,of course, was fine, as it is cooked in a microwave and it is really hard to screw that up.  The rolls, on the other hand, were far from greatness. The fish on the roll dry and tasteless.  The "spicy" tuna rolls we had ordered did not even contain ANY spice. It was purely chopped up tuna, no joke. My kids would not even finish their first stick of chicken as they didn't like the taste.  I tried it for myself, and I had agree with them.  I couldn't finish a single stick either.  I'm sorry, but how do you screw up teriyaki?  Well, now I know.  Our waiter did forget to bring us our extra bowls of rice, but he sure didn't forget to charge us for them.  The food here just isn't good.  Your restaurant can have all the gimmicky rolls they want, but if your ingredients are bad, then it's all for naught.  It's no wonder why they have jalapenos in their rolls.  It's all to block out the taste of the bad fish.  Overall, if you are looking for a trendy sushi spot, this might be your place, but even then, there are much better "trendier" spots out there(RA Sushi, whose sushi is still mediocre at best).  Otherwise steer clear because unless you've had enough sake to numb your tongue of the taste of their sushi, you will definitely be left hungry and unsatisfied.

NkGqR64OzFQ6QVluz2eoPg.text: great sushi! kind of overpriced for what it is..but the staff are rude and complain about how little tips they get and how old people don't tip etc. its just rude. i dare you not to tip and then try to get a smile out of one of these waiters, even on a carry out order i got the ice cold shoulder for not tipping, are you serious? overall, go to sushi 101 or RA.

NIBKLZa1VbBhlwhZX0R0vA.text: When I'm broke but have an expensive appetite.. and the yearning to get slightly tipsy, this place does the job. I love getting the Las Vegas rolls, and basically anything with cream cheese.. top it off with some sakebombs and wohoo, I'm a happy girl! It's not as fancy as RA, but I love the chill atmosphere. Definitely one of my favorite places out here!

FhVLxr6b4GCyawt0VMoZwQ.text: I've been saying for a few years now that this place has the best sushi in the valley.  (yes, better than the expensive places in Scottsdale)  I think other people are starting to notice because when I first started going here the place used to be mostly empty, this last weekend I had to wait to get a table.  It was totaly worth the short wait, the food it always awsome and I'm glad to see this place getting the attention it deserves.

Xl_PsFwr8qkbZT2b_BRX1w.text: Okay so I don't want to bring my 6 year old into a sushi restaurant. Its Saturday and I call for take out, thinking we've done Ra and Sushi 101 so lets try Bombers. We brought home sashimi, tataki and sushi. Its priced between Ra and Sushi 101 but both my husband and I thought it was meh at best, blech at worst. Maybe its a better experience if you're there and drinking, but we were not impressed. Its not impeccable fish, its just okay.

HmUTSSYxBfzH98mDIPn3wQ.text: Ok, so the sushi/food itself only really deserves about 3 stars but the fourth star is what makes my friends and I always come back.  During happy hour sake bombs are $5 and they do amazing $3 shots with cute little fruity names like 'green gummy bear' and 'orange sunkist' now you're never going to get tipsy off of one of their $3 shots...that's why you have a minimum of three! Just think of it this way...if you're out at a club you're going to be spending about $10/shot anyway, but at SakeBombers, you're getting 3 for the price of one...are you following? I guess what is also amazing about this place is that it is RIGHT across the street from my house which means my friends and I can walk and there is real no excuse for anyone to not drink :0) come with some friends for happy hour and have some fun!

dkSA5DeMCgtnjLnmA5hwXA.text: Great sushi.   I was surprised about how good the sushi was.  It looked like a converted Village Inn, on the outside (and it was), but do not let that fool you.    Its really good sushi and its nice inside.     And compared to some of the other over priced Sushi places in town, its the best value.     Happy hours are good too

Pc4SZ8cdgyObG_LKHOdRoA.text: Being a native New Yorker, I am very picky about my food and I must say SakeBomber really surpasses my expectations. Just because the restaurant looks like a "teen hangout" corner, don't let that fool you thinking the food will be mediocre. The sushi and rolls are great and the price is reasonable. The food is very fresh, and they come in a good quantity (unlike New York city style sushi haha), and the service is good. What else can I say? I wish i would've eaten there more, because now i have to pay even more for sushi in New York that was just as good in Sakebomber.
